loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old. She is a widow with three children. It's been five years since her husband died due to cardiac arrest. Gemma stands as both father and mother to her three children.

Gemma manages her fish-selling, hog-raising and corn farm businesses. She is thankful with God because through her patience and hard work, she is able to manage her businesses well.

Gemma's gained income goes toward their daily necessities, allowance of her youngest child and maintenance to her hog-raising and farming business.

This time, she struggles with a shortage of income due to an abrupt increase in their household and hog-raising expenditures. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which will allow her to buy additional kilograms of tilapia for her fish-selling business. She hopes to get this amount of loan to educate her youngest child and sustain all their basic necessities in life.

loans.use: to buy additional kilograms of tilapia for her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Shelfa

texts.en:
Shelfa works hard to support her family. Shelfa is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.

Shelfa requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Shelfa has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Shelfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old and a widow with two children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs and poultry. Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Enhbat is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Dulamjav, age 40, has just started running a used clothes retail business. His sons Buyanjargal, Buyantogtoh and Buyanhishig study at local schools. 

The borrower has been a herdsman for years and over the last few years of harsh winters and lack of forage, his livestock has decreased a lot. His wife started business to increase the family income and he is now requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase forage and vitalized food for his livestock and support his wife's newly starting business. Both the borrower and his wife are welcoming, hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase forage and vitalized food for his livestock and support his wife's newly starting business

loans.name: Virginia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Virginia desde muy pequeña se vio en la urgencia de desarrollar la habilidad de hacer negocios porque sus padres vendían mariscos en panas para el sustento de su familia hoy en día es también una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos para su hogar, ella vende en las costas pescado por libras o chuleteados a personas que se dedican al comercio en panas en la zona de Managua y san Rafael del sur. 

Hoy en día requieren de fuentes de financiamiento para poder resolver la demanda de sus clientes que cada día son más las personas que se dedican a este tipo de comercio por ser un producto de alto contenido de omega tres que ayudan a la prevención de enfermedades del organismo.
texts.en:
Virginia had to learn how to work and do business at a very early age in order to help her parents who sold seafood to support the family.  That same business is now one of the main sources of income in Virginia's own home.  She sells cleaned fish by the pound to salespeople in Managua and San Rafael del Sur.

Virginia needs a loan in order to meet customer demand for her products.  More and more people are starting to work in this business as the produce is high in Omega 3 which helps prevent disease.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nenita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Lycie

texts.en:
Lycie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lycie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Lycie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Dulce requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Dulce would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Namuun-Aizam

texts.en:
Namuun-Aizam is 25 years old lives with his wife and son in a ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Tuya, is 27 years old and works at a local grocery store. Namuun-Aizam's son, Erhembayar, is five years old and goes to a local kindergarten. Namuun-Aizam has been working as a carpenter and he also works from time to time making furniture at home during his free time.

Namuun-Aizam is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for his new business making traditional Mongolian furniture items at home. He is a hardworking, diligent, and positive man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to make traditional Mongolian furniture items at home

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a married parent with three children. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Crisanta works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 19 loans from NWTF.

Crisanta is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo, 59, is unsatisfied with the income from his 'sari-sari' business because it is not enough to cover the family's necessities. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, vinegar, cooking oil and soft drinks.  He hopes that someday, they will experience a better standard of living through the enhanced income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, spices, vinegar, cooking oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is married woman who sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month that she uses for meals and to provide revolving capital for her business. 

Nelita is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to buy more fruit and vegetables, such as cabbages, eggplant, and tomatoes, to sell. In the future, she hopes to keep diversifying her business and increase her profits to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables, such as cabbages, eggplant, and tomatoes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and married with three children. She works selling fish to the people in her village and usually earns about 3,000 PHP each month that she uses for meals, to pay bills at home, and as an allowance for her children. 

Virginia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more fish, such as milk fish, mud fish, and crabs, to sell. Her loan will help increase her sales and income from her business. In the future, she hopes to keep earning and saving funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy milk fish, mud fish, and crabs to sell

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
From the time Lola started surfing, she knew she had a passion for the sport and culture.  Although most surfers were men, Lola embraced being a female surfer.  As she began surfing more, she found that the typical surfboard just didn’t meet the needs of a female surfer, and that the regular boards were bulky and difficult to manage.  She began to order custom-shaped boards that worked better for her body.

Lola quickly learned that she was not alone and that many other female surfers wanted a surfboard more proportional to their build.  Girls at the beach kept asking her how to get a board like hers—sometimes literally buying the board out from under her arm.  Lola saw that many girls needed boards made just for them and had the idea for her business, Chick Sticks, a company specifically dedicated to providing surfboards and gear just for girls.  

Lola quit her job as a realtor and put all of her savings towards opening her shop.  Since then, she’s expanded to a second factory location where her team of employees cut, shape, paint and glass the boards in-house.  

What sets Chick Sticks apart is Lola’s energy, creativity and commitment to empowering young girls. Before being painted, each board receives a special message of encouragement from Lola herself.  Lola also sponsors a surfing team of over 20 girls, providing boards and gear to many who would be unable to afford to compete.

With this Kiva loan, Lola will be able to purchase new stock and inventory so she can work ahead of the influx of orders she receives for custom boards.  Lola will also be able to embark on her new line of athletic wear for girls, which will provide them with surfing wear and gear designed specifically with their needs in mind.  With this new growth, Lola hopes to share her message of empowerment to girls who surf and skate alongside the best of the boys.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Lola from United States

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to make surfboards for girls

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
This is Glenda. She previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 21,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Glenda dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her family will have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 41 years old and is married with five children. To earn a living, Maribel is engaged in direct-selling business. She has been in this business for six years. She usually earns about PHP 2,000 per month for these activities. Right now, Maribel needs additional capital. In this regard, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to purchase more lotion, cologne, powder, and lipstick to display and sell in their village.

loans.use: to purchase more lotion, cologne, powder, and lipstick to display and sell

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
This is Maricar. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricar dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Nandintsetseg is 23 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a 'ger' in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband Hureltulga, age 23, works at the local police department. Her daughter Azbolor, age 2, just started going to local kindergarten. The borrower has been running a small cafeteria in a rental place and she is now planning to start up her clothing sales business in a rental counter of a local market. She is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her clothing sales business. She is hardworking, open-minded and an honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebaatar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a 'ger' in Hentii province of Mongolia.  His wife Bishuubazar, age 22, has just given birth to their youngest son Chngisbayar and stays home taking care of their four little ones: Yundenbazar, age 5, Chimedlham, age 3 and Yunden, age 2. 

The borrower has been working as a woodman for years and is now starting his own business as a carpentry service provider. He needs 1,000,000 MNt to purchase equipment and tools to start his carpentry business. He is hardworking, responsible and a well-behaved man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start his carpentry business

loans.name: Dúo Xetzac De Tecpan Group

texts.es:
DUO XETZAC DE TECPAN
Doña Elvia Dolores es originaria del municipio de Tecpan tiene 19 años de edad  y se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a una tienda de venta de artículos de consumo diario.
Ella empezó su propio negocio con una pequeña tiendecita  en la comunidad donde vive  ya que en el sector no lo hay, y asi también elabora tejidos típicos a mano, gracias a Dios poco a poco su negocio a crecido.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su tienda surtirlo con mas variedad de productos y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para poder apoyar a sus padres.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en:
XETZAC DE TECPAN DUO

Mrs. Elvia Dolores, 19, is originally from the municipality of Tecpan. She makes traditional, hand-made clothes and has a grocery store.

She opened a small store in the municipality where she lives because the area did not have one. She makes at the same time traditional, hand-made clothes. Thanks to God, her business has grown step by step.

Her dream is to expand her store and stock it with a wider variety of products in order to make better profits and be able to support her parents. She is requesting a loan to buy essential food products.

loans.use: to buy essential food products.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three children, in a house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Osohbayar, age 37, is serving in the local military. Her daughter, Uugantuya, age 15, and sons Batsaiha, age 13, and Batbaylag, age 2, go to local schools and kindergarten.

Borrower has been in business, making traditional boots at home, since 2007. Her business is seasonal, and she is now planning to expand her product variety, to make her business more stable. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory and equipment for starting to manufacture modern boots and shoes, to sell to local customers. She is a hard-working, enthusiastic and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment with which to begin manufacturing modern boots and shoes, to sell to local customers

loans.name: Diakhou's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Keur Serigne Bara est créé depuis le 14 décembre 2008; il est constitué de membres qui habitent le même quartier et leur principale activité est le commerce. Ces deux femmes qui font partie dudit ont déjà bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elles ont remboursé sans difficultés elles sont au cycle 9.

La représentante Diakhou, est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée elle est mère de 5 enfants dont 3 filles. Elle est restauratrice et sur la photo elle est à gauche vêtue de bleu.

Elle compte acheter des denrées en quantité (riz,huile, légumes.....)Elle vend des repas à midi et le soir.


Ce prêt de 400000 F CFA va lui permettre d'augmenter sa capacité financière pour mieux développer son action de restauration et satisfaire les clients et ainsi se faire plus de revenus qu'avant.

Les bénéfices générés serviront en grande partie à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille; la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Keur Serigne Bara banc villageois has been in existence since December 14, 2008. Its members live in the same neighborhood, and their main business activity is retailing. The two women forming the group have already obtained eight loans and repaid them without issues. They are now on their ninth loan cycle. 

Diakhou, the group’s representative is 45 years old. She is married with five children, three of whom are daughters. She cooks food for sale. On the phot, she is on the left dressed in a blue outfit. She plans to stock up on basic food products (rice, oil, vegetables etc). She sells cooked dishes at midday and in the evening. This loan of 400,000 West African francs will allow her to grow her financial capacity in order to better manage her food business and meet her customers’ expectations while increasing her revenues. The revenues will mainly be used to improve life conditions of her family and pay for the healthcare and school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy food items for her cooked food business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 50 years old, is married to a private employee and has been blessed with four children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village. She's been in this business for only three months. From this business her net income is PHP 6,000 a month. She would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase items to resell, such as noodles, biscuits, canned goods, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that her store will expand and, moreover, she will have a lot of income.

loans.use: To purchase general store inventory items, like noodles, biscuits, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie, 44, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Gil, a meat vendor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their businesses. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece, with a mark-up. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory. Marie hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education.  She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, with which to stock her variety store

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
This is Edelyn. She works selling fish and previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of fresh and salt water fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and to provide for her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Edelyn is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional fresh and salt water fish that she needs in her business. The more fish displayed at her stall the better, as she knows that more items to sell will result in better profit. Edelyn's business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

In the future, Edelyn hopes that her business will continue to grow and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fresh and salt water fish to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a hardworking and encouraging person who has been a farmer over eighteen years. During that time, he made many sacrifices to meet the needs and wants of his family. Daniel wants to improve his family's lives by farming and he wants to improve his income through his staying strength and hard work. 

Daniel is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide. These inputs are essential to his business and he will be very happy if his requested loan is given.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Javkhlantugs

texts.en:
Javkhlantugs is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For the past seven years, Javkhlantugs has been operating a local taxi service. His wife has been working in Korea on an employment contract for about three years and his daughter recently went to Korea for study. Javkhlantugs used his previous loan to purchase another automobile that he rents to other people. He works day and night so his automobile usually needs repair.

Javkhlantugs is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare automobile parts such as a bumper, alternator fan, halogen lights, and coil wires. His loan will help him to continue to provide his taxi service to local people. His updated automobile will also attract more customers to his business and increase customer satisfaction. Javkhlantugs is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: 01.11.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân is 30 years old; she is married with one child, who she supports with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread; she has been involved in this business for five years.  

Vân is the group leader of the 01.11.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. This is Vân's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase bread and meat for resale.

The main hardship Vân faces in her business is lack of capital.

In the future, Vân hopes her family will be healthy and happy, her business will do well, and she can make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase bread and meat for resale.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 37 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married with two children, age nine and 16, who live at home and attend school. Kou is a college student. For the last seven years, she has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper, coal, etc. 

Kou has requested this loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, coal, etc. She says her problem is low inventory in the business. Kou started her business by helping her husband in a shop, so from that point she learned it. It makes her proud because it helps her to send her children to school. 

In the future, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, coal, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete a side security wall.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Juana Francisca se dedica al cultivo de frijol, tomate y otros rubros los cuales se desarrollan en este tipo de suelos, es una persona muy dedicada con sus cultivos lo cual hace que sus cosechas sean las esperadas para pagar sus compromisos con las fuentes de financiamiento, requieren de préstamos para compra de insumos, alquiler de terrenos así como para compra de reservas de alimentos para su hogar, con la institución son cuatro créditos los cuales ha pagado en tiempo y forma.
texts.en: Juana Francisca works farming beans, tomatoes, and other items that grow in this type of soil.  She is very dedicated to her crops since she hopes that her harvests will be sufficient to pay her commitments to her funding sources.  She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, pay rent on her land, and also to purchase food reserves for her home.  She has taken four loans with the institution and has paid all of them in full and on time.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, pay rent on land, and purchase food.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 47 years old lives with his wife in a ger in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Tsetsgee, is 50 years old. She is retired and stays home. Batsaihan's children are married and live separately. Since 2009, he has been running an inter-city organic dairy products transport and sales business. Batsaihan has gained a lot of experience and customer trust over the years. 

Batsaihan is requesting a 4,700,000 MNT loan to purchase a vehicle for his organic dairy transport and sales business. He is hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for his organic dairy transport and sales business

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. For the past 15 years, Clarita has been operating a fishing business together with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Clarita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for her boat. With her loan, she and her husband will be able to improve their fishing business as well as augment their income. In the future, Clarita hopes to make their business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for her boat

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito dreams of having professional (educated) children, so he pursues his farming business to provide their necessities. He is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides. 

Due to the continuous high cost of commodities and farm inputs, he needs to ask for assistance. 

He promises to use the loan wisely to promote his children’s education, as well as their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for his farming business.

loans.name: 02.01.03 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture, growing food. Hương has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan, to purchase rice to resell and to grow rice for eating.

Hương is 48 years old, and she is married and has four children. She is the group leader of the 02.01.03 Đông Hải solidarity group, which is comprised of seven members, all women. One of her children is grown up, so now Hương supports three dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, seeking to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hương hopes to help her family to be healthy and happy. Further, she hopes that her children will do well in school, and that her business will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell and to grow rice for eating

loans.name: Florence S.

texts.en:
Florence S. is 33 years old and lives in Montserrado County; it has the largest free port, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.

She is single, with a ten-year-old child who attends school and lives at home. She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for the past 18 years.  She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend; she learned this business from her mother. 

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business.

In the future, she wants to build house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business.

loans.name: Jose Cecilio

texts.es: Don José tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijas y vive con su esposa e hijas en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.  El tiene 12 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de desayunos y almuerzos. Su esposa elabora la comida y el la distribuye utilizando una motocicleta. La venta es de manera ambulante y entrega mediante pedidos. Su clientela son las empresas y negocios pequeños de la ciudad. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 28,000 lempiras, con el cual comprara la materia prima como ser carnes, frijoles, arroz, harina de maíz y de trigo, vegetales, etc. Para la elaboración de almuerzos y desayunos. Su sueño es desarrollar mejor su negocio para obtener ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Don José is 50 years old, married and has two daughters.  He lives with his wife and daughters in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  For 12 years he has had his own business selling breakfasts and lunches.  His wife prepares the food and he distributes it using a motorcycle.  He sells as a street vendor and by delivering placed orders.  His customers are the companies and small businesses of the city.  

The loan that he is requesting is the fourth cycle and is for 28,000 lempiras (HNL).  With the loan he will buy raw materials such as meat, beans, rice, corn flour, wheat flour, vegetables, etc., for the preparation of lunches and breakfasts.  His dream is to better develop his business to obtain income and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the preparation of meals for sale.

loans.name: 01.07.11 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business, selling shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes and sandals to resell. Hoa has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hoa is 38 years old, and she is married and has three children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 01.07.11 Đông Sơn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has two dependents, one of her children being grown up.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, seeking to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals to resell

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Javier Antonio tiene dieciocho años de dedicarse al cultivo de frijol y maíz dos rubros de gran importancia en la dieta de los nicaragüenses, esta zona donde ellos siembran se trata de suelos con buenas características para el desarrollo del frijol principalmente.

 Requieren de fuentes de financiamiento como kiva para hacer sus inversiones en pago de alquiler y compra de insumos, pagan sus compromisos una vez que comercializan el grano, es una persona honesta que paga con puntualidad  por lo que el dinero será devuelto con sus intereses. 

a la vez agradece a estos organismos que se asocian para ayudar a otros que requieren de alguna fuente de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio has worked growing beans and corn for 18 years.  Both crops are of great importance in the diet of Nicaraguans.  This area where they plant their crops has soil that is well suited to the cultivation of beans, in particular.

They need sources of financing such as kiva to make pay rent and also to buy supplies.  They will pay off their loan once they sell their harvest.  He is an honest person who pays on time, meaning that the money will be returned with interest.

At the same time, he is thankful to these organizations that come together to help others who need a way of obtaining loans.

loans.use: buy farming supplies, pay the rent on his land, and buy feed.

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Hajidmaa is 31 years old and lives with her parents, in a house in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her parents are retired and stay home. Borrower has been running a clothing-sales business in town since 2010. She is now starting her own toy store, at a rented counter in the local market. She requests a loan of 2,400,000 MNT, to purchase starting inventory for her new toy store business. She is a hard-working, modest and optimistic woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new toy store business

loans.name: Adyajav

texts.en:
Mrs. Adyajav, 40 years old, lives with her husband, two children and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a fenced lot. Her husband and brother produce and sell expense invoices at large trade centers. Her elder son, who has an eye disability, receives a state pension, and her younger son goes to secondary school.

Adyajav used her previous loan to open a grocery store which has attracted quite a number of customers. Previously, she had been rendering a taxi service to local people. Because she is facing an inventory shortage, Adyajav is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs such as rice and flour.

The borrower is one of the most trustworthy clients of our organization, paying each installment on her debt according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice and flour.

loans.name: 07.01.25 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase feed for her cattle.

Nguyệt is 55 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 07.01.25 Phú Sơn1 solidarity group, which consists of five members. Her children are grown, so Nguyệt supports no dependents with her business. Her business is located in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nguyệt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 36 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business, selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Janet has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for two years, and she earns additional income from selling prepaid load for mobile phones.

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg, 49 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband, Renchinbadam, works as a driver at the local hospital, while her son Erdenemonh, age 23, is a university student and daughter Molor-Erdene, age 17, is a senior student of the local secondary school.

A hardworking and responsible woman, Odonchimeg has been running a butcher shop for years, and is now starting her own taxi service in town. She is therefore requesting a loan of 3,500,000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric-and-gas-consuming vehicle to provide the service.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric-and-gas-consuming vehicle to provide taxi service.

loans.name: Katherine Pamela

texts.es:
Katherine Pamela, tiene 20 años de edad, ella estudia la carrera de Administración, eligió ésta carrera porque le parece es muy competitiva y rentable; sólo le falta un año para terminar completamente su carrera, ahora está iniciando el séptimo ciclo. Uno de sus obstáculos fué que en uno de los semestres tuvo que estudiar sólo tres ciclos por falta de economía,
Paralelamente a sus estudios consiguió trabajo como ayudante de estampado de calendarios y polos, con éste trabajo ella puede ayudar a sus padres a cubrir parte de los gastos de su carrera universitaria.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un estudio contable y administrativo, ser una administradora independiente.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago del ciclo que actualmente está estudiando.
texts.en:
Katherine Pamela is 20 years old.  She is studying administration in school.  She choose this major because it seems to be a very competitive and profitable career.  She only has one year until she completely finishes her studies.  She is currently starting her 7th term.  One of her obstacles was that in one semester she could only study for 3 terms because she didn't have enough money.

While still studying, she got a job printing calendars and shirt patterns.  With this job, she can help her parents cover part of the costs of her college degree.

One of her dreams is to have a degree in accounting and administration and become an independent administrator.

She will use the loan that she receives to pay for her current school term.

loans.use: completely pay for her 7th term in her administration degree.

loans.name: Ismael Antonio

texts.es: Ismael, es un joven estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad pública y auditoria, en la actualidad labora como cajero en una tienda, con su salario paga la mensualidad de la universidad pero sus ingresos son muy pocos y se le hace difícil pagar el curso de titulación que está por empezar, por esta razón el solicita apoyo de crédito para cubrir este gasto, ya que le beneficiara en gran manera porque podrá optar a una mejor oferta de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Ismael is a young student. He studies Public Accounting and Auditing. He works as a cashier in a store and pays for the university’s monthly fee with his salary. However, his income is low and it is difficult for him to pay for the final fees required to validate his degree and this is why he is requesting a loan. This will be highly beneficial for him because he will have better job opportunities and will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the final fees required to validate his Public Accounting and Auditing degree.

loans.name: Sulbaatara

texts.en: Mr. Sulbaatara is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife Otgonjargal, age 35, runs a transportation service in town. His sons Amartaivan, age 13, and Enhtaivan, age 9, go to a local school. Mr. Sulbaatara has been running a taxi service in town since 2008. His wife used to provide tailoring services at home. Now Mr. Sulbaatara is starting a business manufacturing wooden furniture on his plot of land. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase wood inventory to start his furniture manufacturing business. He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase wood inventory to start a business manufacutring wooden furniture

loans.name: Altan-Uya

texts.en:
Ms. Altan-Uya is 23 years old and lives with her brother, in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her brother, Altannaran, works at a local construction company.

Borrower has been working with her mother, making handcrafted souvenirs, since 2008. She has a lot of experience, and has built close relationships with customers and suppliers over the years. Now, she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan, to purchase equipment and tools to start her own handcrafted-souvenir business. She is a hard-working, helpful and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start her own business, making handcrafted souvenirs

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Mary Joy is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase items to sell such as soap, canned goods, spices, and noodles. In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soap, canned goods, spices, and noodles.

loans.name: Hermilo

texts.en:
As the married parent of five children, Hermilo works hard to support his family.

He has a  used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Hermilo is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. 

Hermilo has been sustaining his business activities through his past 22 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help attain his dream to save enough money to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Elena has been in this business for 21 years; she earns additional income from a general store, and farming sugarcane.

Elena has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with help from the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Dúo Flor De Trigo Group

texts.es:
DUO FLOR DE TRIGO
Doña Hercilia es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, Guatemala tiene 51 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus 6 hijos menores de edad  ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de consumo diario todos los días ubicado en su casa en La Giralda Tecpan, y también los dias jueves vende en el mercado municipal los mismos productos.
El esposo de ella trabaja como carpintero y gracias al apoyo de el y el apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio surtirlo con mas variedad de productos para obtener mejores ganancias y asi poder mandar sus hijos a la escuela.
Ha tenido dos créditos kivas y con la puntualidad en sus pagos no ha caído en mora.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en:
The duo "Flor de Trigo" (Wheat Flower):

Hercilia is originally from the town of Tecpan, Guatemala.  She is 51 years old and has 6 young children that she is responsible for.  She has a small store where she sells everyday groceries.  She works every day out of her house in La Giralda, Tecpan.  In addition, she goes to the local market on Thursdays to sell the same goods.

Her husband works as a carpenter and thanks to his support and that of their children, she progresses with her business.

Her dream is to expand her business by obtaining a greater variety of goods to sell.  In this way, she hopes to obtain greater profits and be able to send her children to school.

She has received 2 kiva loans and due to always paying on time hasn't fallen behind.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy basic grocery foods.

loans.use: buy basic grocery foods.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 31-year-old married woman, and the mother of three young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband are in the fishing business, which they have been doing for more than 12 years. This is their source of income.

Melanie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks, and others things.

In the future, Melanie hopes to make their business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks, and other things.

loans.name: Togsbat

texts.en:
Mr.Togsbat is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Monhbayar, is 35 and produces slippers and traditional shoes at home. His son Lhagvasuren, 5, goes to a local kindergarten, and daughter Mongonzul, 13, studies at a local school. 

The borrower has been working at a local market as salesperson since 2003. He has lot of experience, and is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory for his own clothing sales business in rental counter of the local market. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for his own business of clothing sales in a rental counter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like shorts and pants needed in his business.

loans.name: Despiner

texts.en: Despiner  is married with four children, two who go to school. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 700000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works in a shop that she rents, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and ever-increasing prices of used clothes.  She is aspiring to import used clothes in Uganda and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 35 years old, married and has one child. He aimed to upgrade their living status in order to give his family a better living. To generate additional income, he engages in cooking and selling pork and chicken barbecue in the market. He planned to continue and improve the business to generate sufficient income. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000.00 to buy raw ingredients like pork, chicken, hot dogs and seasonings needed in cooking barbecue. He believes that the loan will help him improve the business and hoping that someday, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like pork, chicken, hot dogs and seasonings

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 57 years old and married with four children.

Leny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks and other groceries needed for her business.

Leny has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Leny aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks and other groceries needed for her business

loans.name: Florecita De San Antonio Uno Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura es soltera, de 23 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, ella se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales domesticos, en especial cerdos, inició este negocio criando gallinas ponedoras y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia en este negocio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamos que lo utilizará para la compra de cerditos para criarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro quiere tener una granja con cerdos y gallinas; las demás integrantes se dedican a a la crianza de ganado porcino y a tienda de productos de consumo diario.

Una de las integrantes del grupo no figura en la foto porque no pudo asistir cuando se tomaron la misma.
texts.en: Aura, 23, is single and completed six years of elementary school. She buys, raises, and sells livestock, especially pigs. She began her business five years ago raising laying hens. She organized a group to apply for loans, which she will use to buy piglets to raise and sell. She would like to have a pig and chicken farm one day. The other group members raise pigs and run a grocery store. One group member was unable to be present for the photo.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Enhnyam, 39 helps her husband to run their organic vegetable growing and production business. His daughter, Enhtsetseg, 10, and son, Batbayasgalan, 6, go to the local school. The borrower has been growing and producing organic vegetable products since 1990 on his plot of land. He and his wife have obtained lot of experience over the years. He is now requesting 500,000MNT to purchase organic lettuce to produce kimchi for local customers. He is a hardworking and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase organic lettuce to produce kimchi for local customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the production of traditional textiles.

loans.name: Dúo Rositas Group

texts.es:
DUO ROSITAS
Doña Sebastiana ella es originaria del municipio de tecpan tiene 30 años de edad y bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad,  ella se dedica a la crianza de animales y a elaborar tejidos típicos a mano.
Desde hace algunos años ella se dedica a esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia gracias a Dios poco a poco su negocio a crecido. 
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio. 
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio comprar materia prima para tejidos y comprar otra vaca para crianza y asi obtener mejores ganancias.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana belongs to Dúo Rositas. She is originally from the town of Tecpan. She is thirty years old and has three minor children under her charge. She works raising livestock and weaving traditional textiles by hand. She has been doing this for several years in order to provide for her family, and thankfully her business has grown little by little.

Her husband works as a laborer and she keeps her business going with his support.

Her dream is to further expand her business, to purchase raw materials for weaving and buy another cow to raise, so that she may obtain a higher profit. She is requesting this loan to purchase traditional textiles.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for weaving traditional textiles.

loans.name: Unidos Por Jehova Group

texts.es:
les “UNIDOS POR JEHOVA” máxima es una de las integrantes del grupo  grupo formado por personas empeñosas y trabajadoras. Máxima tiene 54 años tiene un hijo mayor. Máxima en negociante ambulatoria  vende  de huevos de codorniz, gelatina, patita de res,  hace mas de 22 años los domingos trabaja en casa haciendo limpieza. Su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de ropa útiles escolares. El grupo agradece a los  inversionistas KIVA. Máxima es la tercera del lado izquierdo polo negro y  carga  a un niño de polo color celeste.

them "UNITED FOR LORD" is one of the highest in the group formed by people empeñosas group and women. Max is 54 years old have an older child. High in ambulatory trader sells quail eggs, gelatin, beef leg, over 22 years ago on Sunday at home doing cleaning works. His greatest wish is to have his own house. The loan will be used to purchase school supplies clothes. The group thanked KIVA investors. Max is the third of the left black polo and cargo to a colored polo celeste.celeste child.
texts.en: Máxima belongs to the communal bank UNIDOS POR JEHOVA, a group of dedicated and hardworking people. Máxima, 54, has an adult son and has been selling quail's eggs, gelatine, and beef hoofs as a street vendor for more than 22 years. She also cleans the house. Her greatest wish is to own a house. She will use this loan to buy clothing and school supplies. The group thanks the Kiva lenders. In the photo, Máxima is wearing a black polo and is holding a child wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucila has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucila requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Lucila has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lucila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años ,esta casada con  Eugenio de 54 años y tiene 3 hijos .Actualmente reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble, cuya ocupación es en calidad de alquiler .Actualmente posee una tienda de abarrotes y se inicio en este negocio poco después de culminar su trabajo como cocinera de restaurante ya que era una actividad muy trabajosa .
Inicialmente su negocio era muy sencillo pero con el paso de los años logro consolidarlo hasta complementarlo con la venta de víveres tanto como kekes, gaseosas y diversa variedad de comestibles.En ocasiones cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y esto le permite estar al lado de su familia .Al tratarse de un negocio cuya mercadería debe ser repuesta constantemente para mantener la buena afluencia de clientes recurre a su entidad financiera para solicitar un crédito y proceder con la compra de su mercadería.Maria tiene como objetivo a largo plazo la ampliación de su negocio de manera considerable y agregar maquinas de juegos paralelo a su negocio.Está será la segunda vez que accede a un crédito de MFP ya que considera una buena oportunidad para sacar adelante su negocio razón por la cual requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de cereales, gaseosas, galletas, conservas, fideos y golosinas .
texts.en:
María, 46, is married to Eugenio, 54, and they have three children. They live in a rented, well-built house. She opened a grocery store shortly after leaving her demanding job working as a restaurant cook. The business was very small at first, but over the years she has been able to build it by selling products such as cakes, sodas, and other foodstuffs. Her daughter helps her at times, which lets her spend time with her family. 

In order to keep her business stocked and service her customers, she is applying for a loan to buy merchandise. Maria's long-term goal is to grow her business and add gaming machines. This will be her second loan cycle with MFP. She believes this will be a great opportunity to grow her business. She needs 2,000 nuevos soles to buy grains, sodas, cookies, jams, noodles, and sweets.

loans.use: to buy groceries and sweets.

loans.name: Bella Leida

texts.es:
La Sra. Bella vive en Guayaquil, tiene 34 años. Empezó esta actividad porque su conyugue cuando vivía se dedicaba a la ebanistería y ella aprendió, cuando el murió esto se convirtió en el sustento para la familia.

Ella realiza su trabajo actualmente comprando palet y los convierte en cómodas junto con la ayuda de su cuñado. 

Le dificulta la competencia del sector y la delincuencia que hay en la ciudad, es viuda tiene tres hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar goma, pintura, palet. Lo que quiere en el futuro es que sus hijos  puedan seguir estudiando y que que pueda tener más trabajo, para que nada les falte.
texts.en: Bella, 34, lives in Guayaquil.  She started this activity because when her spouse was alive he worked as a cabinetmaker and she learned; when he died this became her means of family support.  She does her work currently buying pallets that she turns into chests of drawers with help from her brother-in-law.  The difficulty she faces is competition in the sector and crime in the city.  She’s a widow with three children attending public school.  She wants to use the loan to buy glue, paint and pallets.  What she’d like in the future is that her children can continue attending school and to have more work so that they will have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy glue, paint and pallets.

loans.name: Luz Andina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ ANDINA”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de cotillones, venta de raspadillo, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, albañilería, venta de chantilin, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por  iniciativa de una amiga que le aconsejó y al contar con un pequeño ahorro emprendió este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal group Luz Andina is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, which belongs to the regional office of Senkata. It comprises eight members and is governed by a board of directors, Elsa being their President. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, such as: making party favors, selling snow cones, selling food, selling soft drinks, working construction, selling cakes, and running a neighborhood store.

The loan they are taking out will benefit Elia's group of small businesswomen. She says she has belonged to Pro Mujer for two cycles, and became a member through a friend who is also a member and invited her. She currently has a business that sells clothing. She says she started her business through a friend's initiative and advice. Since she had some small savings, she started her business.
 
She will use the loan she is now taking out to increase capital (purchase clothing). She will buy it from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and later sell it from her stand. This type of work allows her to generate income so that she can support her household as much as possible, because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the trainings on health and lending.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Violenda

texts.en: Violenda works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Violenda requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, sticky rice, etc. for her business. Violenda has been in this business for 17 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, and sticky rice for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia offers cosmetic products, shoes, shirts and blouses within her neighborhood. She has been engaged in this kind of business for six years. Delia is married with four children.
Delia would like to increase the stocks of shoes, blouses and cosmetics products because of many orders she needs to fulfill. She has been unable to fulfill them due to insufficient funds. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. She knows that with this loan she can satisfy her costumers and make sure she has the products requested. This loan will be used to buy stocks of blouses, cosmetic products and shoes for her direct selling business. Delia hopes and prays that her loan will be granted and she is able to get ahead in life and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy stocks of blouses, cosmetic products and shoes for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 21 years old and sells vegetables to make a living. She lives with Joey who is her partner in the business. She had been in the business for two years now. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants to sell. She would like to keep achieving good sales and income so that her business grows and to save funds to use in emergencies.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Les Soeurs Unies Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA représente le groupe LES SŒURS UNIS. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Elle vend du bois de chauffe depuis 06ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les provinces avec les camions. Ses clients  sont les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 04 rangées de bois.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour acheter une machine à détecter l’or. Elle ambitionne agrandir  son champ d’activité mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata represents the Sœurs Unies [united sisters] group. She is married and mother to five children, the oldest of whom is 15 and the youngest 3 years of age. Four of her children go to school, and she has five people under her care.

Fatoumata has worked selling firewood for six years. She gets her supplies from trucks in the provinces, and her customers are female. 

Fatoumata wants to buy four loads of wood. She wants to save her profits to buy a gold-detecting machine, and plans to expand her area of business while also looking after her family.

loans.use: To buy four loads of wood.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha tiene 59 años, casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de 12 años,  se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años ella confecciona ropa Quirófano, batas para doctores,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona del Tejar. Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Bertha va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas, escrach y botones  para la confección de batas por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que ella tiene contratos con hospitales a los que entrega el producto terminado,  como también entrega a distintas ferias donde venden ropa,  La Sra. Bertha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes. , La Sra. Bertha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Bertha, 59, is married and has a 12-year-old son.  She works making clothes.  She’s been doing so for several years.  She manufactures surgical scrubs and doctors’ gowns.  Her workshop is located at home in the Tejar zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Bertha is going to use it to buy fabric, basting and buttons to make gowns at wholesale.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase investment capital because she has contracts with hospitals she needs to fill as well as with various street markets where they sell her clothes.

The business challenge Bertha faces is increasing income.  She plans to use profits to invest in the purchase of good quality clothes making supplies so she can fill more customer orders.  Bertha is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Tacajalve Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Maria de estado civil casada, cuenta con 40 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, tiene una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio vendiendo chicles en una escuelita y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia en este negocio; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de producto para surtir su tienda, como: azucar, fideos, arroz, huevos, aceite, embutidos, etc. en el futuro quiere contar con una abarroteria; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y al comercio.
texts.en:
Santos Maria is married and she is forty years of age. She has five children, and two of them are in school. She has a store that sells staple goods. She started her business selling chewing gum at a small school, and so far has six years of business experience. She also has the support of her husband, who is a retailer.

She has organized a group in order to be able to request a loan, which she will use to buy products to stock her store, such as: sugar, noodles, rice, eggs, oil, cold cuts, etc. She would like to have a grocery store in the future.

The other members of this group work in sales and raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en: Norie has been engaged in rice farming for over 10 years and she usually earns PHP 15,000 per crop year. She is working hard every day to lift her family out of poverty. She is married to a farmer who helps her manage their farm. With the income generated from her business, she has been able to give daily allowances to her children who are studying. Presently, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old, married and a mother of five children. She runs a retail shop and grocery shop. This has been her income generating business for the last two years. She makes an average monthly income of KES. 8,000.
She has requested a loan of KES. 10,000, with which she intends to purchase more items such as sugar, rice, tea leaves, bar soap and groceries to restock her store. She anticipates earning profits which she will use to expand her business by increasing the number of items to meet her client’s demands.
Grace hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her grandchildren as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items i.e sugar, rice, tea leaves,bar soap and groceries to restock her shop shelves.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons. 

Shehnaz is a very hardworking and independent woman. Since 2005, she has been running a bedsheet selling business with the support of her husband.  

Presently she is in need of purchasing a variety of materials for her business like cloth, thread, needles, etc. For that, as a member of a seven-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income and savings. 

Shehnaz is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her family and business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making bedsheets.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house, selling groceries, like noodles, fish, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, cigarettes, and water. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She began her business a year ago, with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy more inventory, like noodles, fish, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, cigarettes, and water.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
This is Ismael. His previous loan was a big help, not just for his business, but also for the education expenses of his children. He was able to buy the needed spare parts of his tricycle unit. He has been in this business for nine years now. He also has a videoke unit for rent. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ismael would like to apply for another PHP 12,000 loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ismael hopes to have another tricycle unit and dreams to have a good life with his family. Every week, he meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and to study the Word of God. It is through these studies that he can draw strength and inspiration. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is 55 years old, and married with five children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelma has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Nelma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.
Nelma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila,  tiene 73 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 9 hijos todos son mayores de edad y vive en el municipio de San Antonio de Cortes con uno de sus hijos. Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de hielo, licuados, comidas como pastelitos, tamales y otros. Doña Lucila ha solicitado el quinto préstamo, el cual es por 7,000 lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para elaborar comida y para la venta de hielo. Su plan es seguir trabajando con los créditos y poder adquirir algunas cosas que necesita en el hogar.
texts.en:
Lucila, 73, is a single mother; she has nine adult children and lives in the municipality of San Antonio de Cortes with one of her children.  She has her own business selling bags of ice, blended drinks and food like little cakes, tamales and others.

Lucila is requesting her fifth loan for 7,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy ingredients for her food preparation and for the ice sales.  Her plan is to continue working with loans and to be able to get some things needed at home.

loans.use: to buy food-making supplies and bags for ice.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, de 40 años de edad, casada, vive en una aldea rural de Santa Bárbara, tiene un hijo de 16 años quien esta estudiando. Su esposo realiza trabajos de construcción adicional a la agricultura.
Doña Mirna, muy trabajadora, tiene 16 años de dedicarse a la producción de café, y vende el café en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local. Le dedica el tiempo necesario a esta actividad. Toda su familia se dedica a producir café, pues donde ellos viven es una zona apta para esta producción. El  préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizante y fungicidas para darle asistencia a su cultivo para mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir ampliando el área de producción para poder ayudar a su hijo con la educación y que este negocio sea su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mirna is 40 years of age, married, and lives in a rural village in Santa Bárbara. She has a 16-year-old son who is at school, and her husband carries out construction jobs in addition to farming.

Mirna is very hard-working, and has been producing coffee for 16 years. She sells the wet parchment coffee in her local market. She spends the time she needs on her business, and all her family works producing coffee, as the area in which they live is well-suited for this kind of farming. 

Mirna has requested a loan of 15,000 Lempiras, which she plans to use to buy fertilizer and fungicides to help her farming and improve her harvest. She also plans to continue expanding her area of production, so that she can help her son with his studies and allow him to inherit her business.

loans.use: To buy fungicides and fertilizers for her coffee farm.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a vegetable vendor at the public market. She is 31 years old, married and has three children. 

Gina patiently sells vegetables to gain an income of about PHP 6,000 each month. She uses it for meals, bills at home, and school fees. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more cabbages, eggplant, and tomatoes to sell.

Gina hopes to keep selling good products to attain more income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, eggplant, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 25 years old, married and has one child. 

Jinky is a retail store owner who gains about PHP 5,000 each month. She hopes to sell more grocery items, and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, breads, and biscuits to sell. 

Someday, Jinky hopes to keep extending good and affordable prices to all her customers to acquire more income for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She is raising hogs to sell, and she earns income of PHP 3,000 each month. She hopes to keep raising healthy hogs to sell, in the future. Her income goes for meals and school fees, for her family. Agapita is now asking for additional capital for maintaining her hogs. She is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs. 

In the future, raising healthy hogs will lead to her obtaining more revenues, and a profitable business for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and married with six children.
Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, bread, coffee, soap, etc.
Elsie has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.
Elsie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, bread, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more merchandise to expand her product inventory. She has been in this business for ten years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
