Con poco capital de trabajo y mucha disciplina inició ofreciendo artículos variados a vecinos y amigos, poco a poco sus esfuerzos dieron fruto, cuando creció su clientela. Hoy muchas veces su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para atender la demanda, porque vende a crédito y requiere mayor liquidéz para ser oportuno con su clientela y continuar sosteniéndose en el mercado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará bermudas, camisetas, suéteres, y pantalones que han sido solicitados por su clientela, con ello planea reinvertir sus utilidades y ahorrar para poco a poco cumplir cada uno de sus sueños familiares.
texts.en: Daniel, a husband and father of two daughters, ages 18 and 22, works daily from 7 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon, on his own account, with the goal of buying his own home in the future. For three years, he has sold assorted merchandise, especially informal clothing, an idea that came about when he recognized his business capabilities. With a little working capital and a lot of discipline, he started offering assorted garments to neighbors and friends. Little by little, his efforts bore fruit, when his customer base grew. Many times his working capital is not sufficient to meet demand, because he sells on credit and he needs more liquidity to be timely with his customers and keep maintaining himself in the market. This is exactly why he is asking for a Kiva loan. This is his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy shorts, T-shirts, sweaters, and pants that his customers have been asking for. He plans to reinvest his profits and save to achieve each one of his family's dreams little by little.

loans.use: to buy shorts, T-shirts, sweaters, and pants.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer casada, madre de 6 hijos en las edades e 16 a 30 años. Con el fin de generar ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de su hogar, ella inició su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras y venta de revistas mediante guías especializadas de productos, partiendo de las necesidades de estos servicios y productos, observadas en sus vecinos.  Su meta de crecimiento no se detienen y por eso necesita  comprar 2 lavadoras mas y una impresora para fortalecer su negocio de transcripciones. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante esta inversión planea ampliar un poco más su mercado y ganar más dinero, que beneficien el crecimiento de su negocio.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos que han generado referentes en el mimo barrio y en otros sectores de diversas comunidades cercanas. Con su buen servicio reflejado en oportunidad y calidad su negocio captará muy seguramente nuevos clientes que fortalecerán su inversión de credikiva.
texts.en: Carmen is married, and is the mother of six children between the ages of 16 and 30. With the aim of earning income to better her household's wellbeing, she started her business renting washing machines and selling magazines though specialized catalogue guides. She started with the needs for those products and services, which she observed in her neighbors. Her goal for growth does not stop and this is why she needs to buy two more washing machines and a printer to strengthen her transcription business. This is exactly why she is asking for a Kiva loan. This is her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with this loan she plans to expand her market and earn more money, which will benefit the growth of her business. Her main customers are her neighbors, who have made references in the same neighborhood and in other parts of various nearby communities. With her good service reflected in opportunity and quality, her business will gain new customers that will strengthen her Kiva credit investment.

loans.use: to buy two more washing machines and a printer.

loans.name: Garmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Garmaa is 43 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children in a ger, in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Olziisaihan, works at a mining company as a driver. Her daughter, Davaajargal, age 20, is a university student. Oyun-Erdene, age 14, and son Gan-Erdene, age 8, go to local schools.

Borrower has been running a small retail store, in a rented place, for six years. She has gained a lot of experience and built close relationships with customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to pay her daughter's university tuition. She is a hard-working, optimistic and neat woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna has been engaged in clothes trading since 1996. She does this activity in a rented stall, in a market in Sevan. The merchandise she buys from Yerevan Wholesale Market, and then she transports them to Sevan for reselling. Her son helps her in this occupation. With the profit that she earns from her trading business, Susanna meets her family's needs.
 
Susanna is 61 years old and lives with her son in Sevan city. She has had a very hard life. She has a long work experience. She graduated from the Medical college of the Red Cross, and for many years she used to work as a nurse, in Sevan hospitals. Susanna is a widow, and her husband has died early. The salary of nurses was so low that, in order to support their son, Susanna launched her own clothes trading business.  She has worked day and night, to provide a sufficient family income. She is very happy now, because she brought up her son alone, and he is a good person.

Susanna asks from Kiva lenders to borrow 1,000,000 Armenian Dram (AMD), to buy spring-summer season clothes from Yerevan wholesale markets. She will resell the clothes in her market stall in Sevan city.

loans.use: To buy spring-summer season clothes from Yerevan wholesale markets, for reselling in her market stall in Sevan

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Luz no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trababa en su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y choclo, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera Luz podrá conseguir mayor cantidad de clientes y podrá atenderlos en un lugar adecuado, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pisco with her husband and young son, whom she loves and is her main driving force in life. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic woman who, along with her husband, does all she can to make sure that her family gets ahead in life. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and her need to work from a very young age, Luz was unable to study accountancy at university. In her free time she likes to watch television, and sometimes cooks a delicious red noodle dish which she shares with her family.

On her own initiative, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Luz works in her small business where she sells vegetables and corncobs. She works every day for about 10 hours, and thinks that her business does well because of her good prices and friendly customer service.

Luz is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they give she will be able to buy a small stall in her city’s central market. In this way, Luz will be able to obtain a higher number of customers, as well as being able to sell to them in a better location. She will continue to work hard so that she can make her dream of having her own house come true.

loans.use: To buy a stall to sell her produce.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 43 years old, and comes from Sachkhere district. He is married and lives with his wife and two children (18 and 20 years old). Irakli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Irakli’s monthly income, earned by working as a driver of a truck. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irakli requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Credo approved his loan request, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to Georgia's rural poor, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Irakli will buy a truck of his own. After purchasing his own truck, Irakli will accept orders to transport various kinds of things, and he will earn profits. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the income and living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy his own truck and get orders for transportation of goods, to earn more income

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
Benigna de 43 años , es viuda y madre de 5 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que compró hace 6 años. 
Sus terrenos se ubican en las extensas áreas verdes del centro del pueblo las cuales estan muy cerca del río ,“mis cosechas son muy buenas, ya que tengo riego a disposición”, afirma. Los principales sembríos que posee son papa y maíz, pues es donde obtiene mayores ingresos económicos. Su trabajo en la agricultura comenzó desde muy niña y desde entonces aprendió lo necesario del campo ya cuando formó su familia, sus padres le brindaron los terrenos donde comenzó a independizarse. “No fue difícil pues cuando era joven acompañaba a mi madre a comercializar los alimentos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde tengo clientes hasta el día de hoy”, afirma. Este es cuarto préstamo con KIVA y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que se le brinda para continuar con su actividad agrícola a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Benigna  invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Benigna, 43, is a widow and the mother of five children, with whom she lives in the house she bought six years ago.

Her land is located very close to the river in the vast green areas of the center of the town.  "My harvests are very good because I have irrigation available," she said.  Her main crops are potatoes and corn because that's where she gets the most income.

She started working in agriculture when she was very little and learned everything she needed to about the land when she had her family.  Her parents gave her the plots of land and she started to go out on her own.  "It wasn't hard because when I was young I used to go with my mother to sell the food in the city of Huancayo, where I still have customers today," she said.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she's very grateful for the financial support she gets to continue with her agricultural activity.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

Benigna will use the 1500 soles [PEN] to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her cornfields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Kizlarsara

texts.en:
Kizlarsara is 46 years old. She is married and has six children. She loves her children and tries to provide them with a high quality of living. Her husband is a man who cannot find enough money for improving the family's living conditions. He is a labor migrant, working in Russia. It is difficult for Kizlarsara to buy food and clothing, and to pay for the other expenses of six children. Sometime her relatives help her with money, but it is not enough.

Kizlarsara wants to organize a new business in animal husbandry, because her house is big and suitable for animal husbandry. She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and earned her certificate. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy two cows, for organizing her new business. Her children will help her with managing the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy two cows for organizing her new animal husbandry business

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widowed woman and lives with her four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store where she works very hard every day. She’s had her small business for two years and, thanks to her work and sacrifice, it’s been growing. 

Mejumaa requests the loan to buy sacks of maize, beans, and other products needed to stock the store, to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, beans, and other products needed to stock the store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella comenta que tiene una pequeña y surtida despensa en su barrio. Ella es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes, los cuales gracias a su trabajo pudo criar con su marido quien realiza trabajos de albañilería.
Su despensa funciona hace varios años, cuenta con clientela formada y gracias a la variedad que siempre da a sus clientes es que se ha hecho muy conocida. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y es por eso que solicita el crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, enlatados, productos a granel y demás para seguir teniendo una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen comes from the town of San Ignacio. She says she runs a small and well-furnished store in her neighborhood. She has 3 adult children who are economically independent, and whom she has succeed in educating thanks to her job and together with her husband, who is a mason.
She has been running her small store for various years, she has established customers and she is really well-known thanks to the variety of products she offers to her customers. She wants to keep on investing in her activity and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, canned food, bulk items, and other merchandise, in order to continue offering her customers a good variety of products.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, canned food, bulk items.

loans.name: Puspanjali

texts.en:
Puspanjali is a 33-year-old responsible daughter. She is a differently abled lady living with her parents and a brother. 

Puspanjali has been involved in sewing for the last six years. When she was 25 years old, she decided to share her father’s burden, earn, and be independent. So, she took training in tailoring, and from then on she has been engaged in tailoring. She currently has two sewing machines, which she utilizes to stitch salwar suits (traditional Indian dresses).

She requested a loan of 30,000 INR through People’s Forum to purchase thread, fabrics, needles, and another sewing machine (picot sewing machine) that will help her do picot stitching for sarees (a special stitch for saree edges) and stitch saree blouses. 

Puspanjali also plans to buy some cloth and make dresses to sell. She says the gain from her business will help her to strengthen her family financially and help her to be more independent. She hopes to be able to train some girls in her village and hire them for help by buying more sewing machines and growing her business, creating a living for other girls in the village.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabrics, needles, and a sewing machine for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Ketty's Group

texts.en:
Ketty's group is comprised of three hard-working, young women. Ketty is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko, in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past one year, Ketty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, flour, rice, and other items. 

To help expand her business, Ketty has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business, by buying more items for inventory, such as sugar, flour, and rice. These purchases will help Ketty to generate greater profits and meet her customers' needs. Ketty hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a bigger store. 

Ketty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to improve the business by buying more items for inventory, such as sugar, flour, and rice

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She previously got a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennifer hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her general store.

loans.name: Maruja Piedad

texts.es:
MARUJA PIEDAD tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene cuatro hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

MARUJA PIEDAD se dedica a la albañieria. Solicita el crédito para comprar un Refrigerador. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el electrodoméstico que tanta falta le hace para el hogar.

 Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Chimbo. 

El sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar caminatas.
texts.en:
Maruja Piedad is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children in the city of Chimbo in the province of Bolívar.  She earns her living as a brick maker.  

She is seeking this loan to buy a refrigerator, which she does not currently have in her home.  She will make the purchase in the city of Chimbo.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life.  In her free time she likes to go on walks.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Enrique Alejandro

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuviera de  de trabajar desde muy joven, Enrique  no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos para distraerse.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Enrique trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa de vigilancia de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño, responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Enrique se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita el taxi de su papá, ya que este se encuentra en mal estado y no puede utilizarlo para brindar servicios de transporte, de esta manera Enrique desea apoyar a su familia, para que junto s puedan salir adelante, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar sus estudios secundarios y luego de ello desea seguir una carrera militar.
texts.en:
Enrique, 21, is single and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings.  He's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic man who has a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately he was unable to finish his secondary education because he didn't have the money and he had to work from a young age, although he would like to have been able to do so.  In his free time he likes to play soccer for fun with his friends.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Enrique works as a security guard for a security company in his city.  He works approximately 12 hours every day.  He believes it's going well for him because of his determination, responsibility, and friendly treatment of others.

Enrique's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to replace parts and perform maintenance on his father's taxi, which is in bad condition and can't be used for transportation.  Enrique wants to help his family this way so they can get ahead together.

He'll continue working and making the effort to achieve his big dream of finishing his secondary studies and then pursuing a military career.

loans.use: to replace parts on his father's taxi

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 years old and married to Janet, who operates a kiosk. He is the father of three children, aged eight, six, and two years. Francis is a mixed farmer. He learned about KADET LTD from other farmers in his area. Besides farming, he operates a motorcycle transport business, to earn income and meet his family's needs.

He has obtained a second loan of KES 40,000, after having successfully repaid his first loan. He will use the new loan funds, together with his savings, to purchase another motorcycle, so he can offer his motorcycle transport services over a wider area.

He will use the anticipated profits to buy farm inputs and to hire a worker. Francis's hope and dream is to expand his business and to, in the future, have a fleet of taxis.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike, which will enable him to offer his motorcycle transport services over a wider area

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 30 years old and married to George (who contributes to the family income). She has been farming for about three years, with an income of KES. 15,000 a month.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD and she wants to use it to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and pesticides. 

She hopes to be a leading farmer and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Redante

texts.en:
Redante is willing to work hard every day in his rice farm business because he wants to give his family a good quality of life. He hopes to sustain his farm business so he can send his children to school and give them a good quality of life. 

He wants to improve his rice farm business, but he has insufficiency capital. 

Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides. 

Hopefully, he can sustain his farm business for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for his rice farm business.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Boldbaatar, age 32, serves in border defense military service. Her son, Terguunsanaa, age 9, goes to a local primary school while her other son, Elbegsanaa, age 1, stays home with Gantsetseg's mother during the daytime. 

Gantsetseg has been running a clothing import and sales business for years and transports her inventory with rental transportation, which costs a lot of money. She is now requesting MNT 2,000,000 to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car to reduce her transportation cost. She is a hard-working, well-managed, and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car to reduce her transportation cost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 29 años de edad su estado civil soltera vive con sus padres vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos 

La VRC  Solidaria, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Daniel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es comprarse un terreno. Los desafíos que enfrentan son las plagas y cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Daniel is 29 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Solidaria” is located in the neighborhood of San Gabriel in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farmers and ranchers.

Daniel is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides. The loan will help him buy what he needs for his farming activities. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas. Daniel’s dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges he faces include dealing with pests and maintaining his crops.

In his free time, Daniel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Bhagaban

texts.en:
Bhagaban is a 36-year-old differently abled person staying with his wife and two children. He has a tea and food stall in his village. 

Bhagaban sells tea, some local snacks like samosa (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), idli (popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), wada (lentil doughnut), etc.  He earns 4,500 INR per month, which is used for his household expenditures. His wife helps him in his business by purchasing the raw materials and preparing the snacks. 

He wants to repair his food stall and purchase some furniture (benches, tables) to seat his customers; also to buy utensils like plates, spoons, etc., which will attract customers and will increase his monthly income. 

Bhagaban has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to fulfill his above requirements and purchase raw materials for preparing food items. He says in this way, he can earn 6,000 to 7,000 INR per month, and he would be able to construct a house and save money for his children’s bright future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing furniture and raw materials; also to renovate his snacks stall.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 30-year-old lady who lives with her parents, husband and two children. She is engaged in the activity of tailoring, and has one sewing machine by which she stitches ladies’ dresses, blouses, frocks, and dresses for kids. From this business, she earns 8,500 INR per month which is not enough for her family. She started this business eight years ago to help her husband in managing the family's monthly cash flow.

Basanti has a plan to grow her business and do this activity on a large scale, so that she can render her services to the maximum number of customers. She wants to purchase two new sewing machines and some fabrics for her shop.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 INR for purchasing two more sewing machines to meet her customers’ demand and make them highly satisfied. She also wants to hire some work force to help her in the business. 

Basanti hopes to provide a better education and study materials to her children and take good care of her family. She has a dream to live a happy life with her family members by fulfilling the family members’ requirements.

loans.use: to purchase two new sewing machines and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, 30 years old and married to Mutisya, who contributes to the family income, has been running her grocery shop for about four years, earning approximately KES. 5,000 a month.

Anna has applied for her first business loan of KES. 15,000 from KADET LTD to buy crates of tomatoes, oranges and onions to resell. She hopes to become a leading vegetables supplier and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes, oranges and onions to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
El Sr. Nestor tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapegua. Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de estudiar y ser un profesional decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, empezó vendiendo ropas y calzados por la zona urbana de su ciudad, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la capital del país donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela. También pudo culminar sus estudios gracias a su trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y quiere poder seguir con sus ventas. Esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Nestor is 30 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents in the town of Carapegua. Coming from a humble family and having a great desire to study and become a professional, he decided to start a small activity by selling clothes and shoes in the urban areas of his town. Having quickly succeeded in putting some working capital together, he began buying a wider variety of products that he then sold in Asunción, the capital city of his country, where he can now count on a good number of established customers. Thanks to his job and to his efforts he has succeeded in buying a motorcycle he uses to sell his products and to keep his good customers. At the same time he has also been able to complete his studies thanks to his job.
He is requesting a loan to buy hammocks, blankets, corsets and sheets, since he has received may requests for these products and he wants to keep on carrying his sales out. He feels very grateful for the chance he has been given, as this will be really useful for him.

loans.use: To  buy hammocks, blankets, corsets and sheets.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señorita Natalia tiene 21 años, es soltera y sin Hijos, ella es de la ciudad de Caacupé, ella cuenta que tiene una carpintería en su casa, donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles desde hace 2 años.
Natalia tiene muchas ganas de progresar y de salir adelante, cuenta que ella recorre por todos lados ofreciendo sus muebles, lo hace a escuelas y distintos lugares. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus muebles y cumpliendo con sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Natalia is 21 years old, she is single and she has no children. She comes from the town of Caacupé, and she has been running a carpentry in her house for 2 years, building every kind of furniture.
Natalia has a great desire to progress and get ahead in life. She is a very hardworking and resourceful woman, and she says the she offers her furniture everywhere in town, in particular to schools and private buildings.
She is requesting a loan to buy wood and other supplies to keep on creating her furniture, thus satisfying her customers’ requests. She is grateful for the chance she has been given as this will be of great help for her.

loans.use: To buy wood and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman, aged 40, and mother to three children living in Kagadi,Uganda. She operates a retail shop in the same town and with the proceeds she has been able to venture into farming and animal sales. She dreams of educating her children up to the University level and buy more land to expand her farming activities. Josephine intends to use the loan to buy salt, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en:
Sherwin is 31 years of age, married and has only one child. Due to the lack of job opportunities, he has set up a computer shop near the school campus. He has been operating this business for almost two years and usually earns a profit of P6,000.00 a month that he utilizes for his family's daily necessities. 

He aims to improve the business and make it more profitable. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional loan of P35,000.00 to buy additional computers for rental use. In the future, he is hoping that the business will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional computers for rental use

loans.name: Edwin Wagner

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 43 años, vive en la ciudad Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Edwin se encontraba estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edwin no pudo culminar sus estudios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Edwin trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir, como polos, blusas, pantalones, camisas, bermudas y otras prendas para damas, caballeros y niños, de esta manera Edwin con ayuda de su esposa podrán iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 43-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and two sons, whom he loves very much and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate all of their efforts to providing a better life for their family.

Thanks to his efforts, Edwin was previously studying for a professional degree in accounting.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the necessity of working, he was not able to finish his studies, though he very much would have liked to do so. In his free time he likes to take walks through the warm and friendly streets of his city.

Through his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Edwin works providing cleaning services at a city agency.  He works every day for approximately 8 hours.  He believes things are going well due to his strong work ethic and his friendly treatment of others.

Edwin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase clothing for resale, such as polo shirts, other types of shirts, blouses, pants, Bermuda shorts and other types of clothing for men, women and children.  He and his wife will then be able to open their own business selling clothes.  They will then keep working and putting forth effort to realize their greatest dream of seeing their sons grow up to be good men with professional careers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
El señor Emiliano de estado civil casado, tiene 22 años de edad, curso el primer año de educacion secundaria tiene 1 hijo, él se dedica a atender su tienda de productos de consumo diario, inició este negocio atendiendo una tienda de otra persona y para la presente fecha cuenta con 4 años de experiencia; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quién se dedica al comercio.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos para su tienda, tales como: Huevos, leche, frijl, arroz, azucar, jabon, fideos, entre otros. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y quiere tener una tienda mas grande.
texts.en:
Emiliano is married. He is 22 years old and finished one year of secondary education. He has one child and works running a store where he sells staple items. He started his business working at a store for someone else, and to this day he has four years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who works in sales.

He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy products for his store, such as eggs, milk, beans, rice, sugar, soap, noodles, and other items. In the future he wants his business to grow and to have a larger store.

loans.use: to purchase staple items.

loans.name: Angel Alberto

texts.es: Ángel Alberto, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y un hijo en una aldea del municipio de Petoa Santa Bárbara. Don Ángel Alberto tiene 10 años de tener su propio negocio donde vende golosinas, como pastelitos rellenos con carne, enchiladas, churros, dulces, pan, refrescos y lubricantes para motocicletas. Para mantener el negocio activo ha invertido varios préstamos, actualmente esta solicitando el octavo ciclo que es por 10,000 Lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para surtir su negocio de refrescos y agua para vender en la temporada de semana santa. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, mantener mayor inventario de lubricantes para motos y estar siempre junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel Alberto is 61 years old and married. He lives with his wife and son in a neighborhood in the town of Petoa Santa Bárbara.

For the past 10 years, Don Ángel has managed his own business where he sells snack foods, meat-filled pastries, enchiladas, donuts, candy, bread, soft drinks, and motorcycle lubricants. In order to maintain an active business, he has invested several loans. Ángel is currently requesting his eighth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL. The money will be used to restock his business with soft drinks and water that he can sell during Holy Week.

His goals are to grow his business, maintain a large inventory of motorcycle lubricants, and always remain with his family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and water to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines, wife to Alberto and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales everyday.

Helen is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helen dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yata

texts.en:
Yata is a 40 year old businesswoman who lives in Yei, South Sudan. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 4 and 17.  All of them go to school.

Yata runs a general store and has been in business for 8 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is requesting a loan of 2000ssp to purchase sandals, soap, sugar and many others items. She has no other source of income besides this business.

In 5 years Yata would like to expand her business and open up a big shop.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market and low income in her business.

Yata says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, sandals, sugar etc.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Salima  has been working hard to manage her boutique which sells clothes, shoes and bags. 

To help expand her business, Salima  has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes to sell, and will help Salima to generate greater profits and increase the income level of her family. Salima hopes that in the future she will be able to build the business . 

Salima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 37 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Monh-Undraa, age 36, helps her husband to run their retail goods import business. His children Altanbat, age 16, and Monhbat, age 14, go to the local school. 

Battulga has been running his retail goods import business since 2001 with his wife. He has his own car which he uses to transport the goods but his car has been broken for awhile and business has stopped because of it. He is now requesting 3,000,000mnt to replace his car with an Eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car so that he can run his business smoothly and with lower cost. He is a hardworking, responsible and positive man.

loans.use: to replace his car with an Eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to smoothly run his business with lower cost

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a married woman, aged 25, a mother to two children, aged six and three, living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

She operates a retail shop in the same town and has been in this business for a period of two years. She supplements this with income from produce sales. Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the University level and to own a wholesale shop. 

Oliver intends to use the loan to buy salt, soap, and crates of soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, and crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his pub, by buying more drinks to resell, like Fanta and local sorghum drink

loans.name: Uva Cecilia

texts.es:
Uva es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Uva se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Uva trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de taxi, gracias al ahorro que pudo obtener de trabajos anteriores, Uva pudo comprarse un auto, el cual lo alquila a choferes de taxis, para que brinden servicios de transporte en su ciudad, ella cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Uva se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su auto, de esta manera tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y podrá seguir alquilándolo, así pues Uva seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una gran profesional y poco a poco al lado de su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Uva, 20, lives in the Parcona area of the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic young woman who has a great desire for improvement.  Thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Uva's studying for a career in business administration.  In her free time she likes to watch television and sometimes she cooks a delicious chicken and rice to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Uva works in her small taxi-rental business.  Thanks to her savings from previous jobs, Uva managed to buy herself a car, which she rents to taxi drivers for them to offer transportation service in her city.  She believes it's going well for her because of her friendly treatment of her customers.

Uva's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to replace parts and perform general maintenance that her car needs, so her working tool will be in better condition and she'll be able to continue renting it.

This way Uva will continue working and making the effort to achieve her big dream of becoming a great professional.  She wants to get ahead with her family little by little.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her taxi

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Miriam  vive en Guayaquil, tiene 41 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio ya que quería encontrar una manera de subsistirse en los gastos del hogar y debido a esto se puso una tienda, en donde gana muy bien.

Este negocio lo hace con la ayuda de su hermana, todos los días. Desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche; por donde vive hay muchas ventas a diario. Teme a la delincuencia ya que gana muy bien.

Está casada y su esposo trabaja de chofer en un bus, tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados, bebeidas y asi hacer crecer más su tienda llenarla de mercadería y además tener un mejor bienestar en su hogar.

Sus sueños son crecer mas en trabajo llenarlo de mercaderia y a la vez traer un vienestar a su casa.
texts.en:
Miriam, age 41, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business because she wanted to find a way to cover the household expenses.  Therefore, she set up a store, where she earns very well.

She works in this business every day with help from her sister.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  There are a lot of daily sales where she lives.  She is afraid of crime because she earns very well.

She is married, and her husband works as a bus driver.  She has four children, and they all attend a public school.

She wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, and drinks.  This way she will fill her store with merchandise and make it grow.  She will also have better well-being in her home.

Her dreams are to grow more in her work, to fill it with merchandise, and to bring well-being to her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, and drinks.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 34 years old and from a small village of Sachkhere district. She is married and lives with her husband, two sons (6 and 8 years old) and father-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. 

Nato requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard with 600 samples of grape vines. They harvest the grapes and produce vodka for selling locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nato requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor. These rural poor do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nato will purchase a milking cow. After purchasing a milking cow, Nato will produce dairy products. She will sell the dairy products at local markets, which will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 48 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, he raises hogs to sell in the future. He usually gains about PHP 3,000 from each hog disposed. 

He had been in the business for almost three years. He hopes to keep raising healthy hogs. That is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to ensure good nutrition for his hogs. 

Gregorio hopes to make his business profitable and become a successful hog grower in their village someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs' sustainability.

loans.name: Enhnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhnasan is 50 years old and the head of family. She lives with her daughter in small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her daughter Monhgerel, age 27, helps her mother to run their business exporting retail goods. They started their retail business in 2008. 

The borrower uses rental transportation to transport goods and that costs a lot. The borrower is planning to purchase a vehicle and now requesting an additional 1,500,000 MNt to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to run their business smoothly at lower cost. The borrower and her daughter are friendly, helpful and hardworking ladies.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to run their export business smoothly with lower cost

loans.name: Munkh-Us

texts.en:
Ms. Munkh-Us is a married, 43-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and baby daughter in the outer 'ger' district (which lacks basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She supports her family by operating a stall at one of the largest outdoor markets of the city. She sells cookies, biscuits and cakes. 

With this loan, she will purchase more products to sell in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more cookies to sell in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Ramesh

texts.en:
Ramesh is a differently-able, 43-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and one daughter in Odisha, India.

He has been operating a small bicycle repair shop, which is the only source of income for the family and a profitable project, but also not enough to cover all the costs and the family's needs. His monthly income is 4,500 INR. He has an experience of 30 years in this business; he started in the business at a very tender age.

He currently has the skills and equipment to do good repairs and replacements but not the required spare parts for replacements. He has to travel almost 15 miles for a good spare part.

Ramesh is requesting a loan of 20,000 INR to cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts used for repairs such as free wheels, chains, tyres, seat covers, etc., for bicycles as well as motorbikes. This will provide Ramesh with a varied collection of spare parts, which will help to increase his income and improve the family's living standard, and allow him to marry his daughter into a good family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing spare parts like free wheels, chains, tyres, seat covers, etc. for his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Lipcia Carolina

texts.es:
Lipcia Carolina de 39 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 12 años. Originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En algunas ocasiones le gusta disfrutar  en compañia de su familia de la cocina y comida típica de la región como “indio viejo”; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar enfermería profesional.

Gracia a  su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como perfumes, cosméticos, base, rubor, sombras de ojos, lapiz de ojos, lapiz labial, ropa variada pantalones, camisas, short, faldas. Ella dedica a su negocio aproximadamente unas 10 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lipcia Carolina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lipcia Carolina is 39 years old, married, and has a twelve-year-old son. She is originally from León, located in the western part of the country. Sometimes she likes to enjoy the regional cuisine with her family: traditional dishes like “indio viejo.” Unfortunately, because she lacked the financial resources, she was not able to attend university, but she would have liked very much to go to nursing school.

Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her eagerness to get ahead, she went into business selling merchandise such as fragrances, cosmetics, foundation, rouge, eye shadow, eye liner, lipstick, and assorted clothing like pants, shirts, shorts, and skirts. She dedicates approximately ten hours a day to her business, and works from home as well as delivering orders door-to-door. 

Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the near future she may obtain better income. Lipcia Carolina appreciates the help Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing and cosmetics like fragrances, rouge, foundation, eye shadow, makeup remover, and lipstick.

loans.name: Lesbia Mayira

texts.es:
La joven Lesbia Mayira  vive en un barrio de Managua, su estado civil es soltero, estudiante de ingeniería en sistema y al mismo tiempo labora en una institución del estado desde hace un año, desempeñándose  como secretaria ejecutiva para poder cubrir su estudio universitario y lograr su meta. 
  
El crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL es para comprar materiales de construcción como bloque, cemento, para terminar de construir un pequeño cuarto ya que su ingreso no le alcanza para cubrir otros gastos.

Con este primer financiamiento que le  otorguen, le será de mucha ayuda para ella y sus padres solo así pueden ir mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia. Da gracia a Dios y a kiva- ceprodel por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Lesbia Mayira is a young single woman who lives in a Managua neighborhood.  She is a systems engineering student and has also been working at a state agency for one year as an executive secretary in order to pay for her university studies and achieve her goals.

She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to buy construction materials such as concrete blocks and cement so that she can finish building a small room, since her income alone cannot cover these costs.

This first loan she is taking will be of great help to her and her parents, as only this will allow them to improve their standard of living.  She gives thanks to God and to Kiva-Ceprodel for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 1 Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes del grupo son de la ciudad de Caacupé, son 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por crecer. Son muy capaces y lo demuestran con el sacrificio que hacen y por la entrega de cada una.
Salvadora es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, lo hace recorriendo y vende empanadas, sándwich, croquetas y demás. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y se le pide mucho. Su negocio le ayuda a seguir con su día a día y cubrir los gastos de la casa.
Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y es por eso que solicita este crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, jamón, queso, huevos, condimentos, verduras y demás, para que pueda seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende y de esa forma seguir con su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que con esto podrá seguir con su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The 15 members of the group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are 15 very hard-working and enterprising women who struggle to grow.  They are very capable, and they show this with the sacrifice that they make and the dedication of each one of them.

Salvadora is one of them.  She sells all types of food in an itinerant manner.  She sells empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and more.  She says that she has very good clientele because her food is delicious and is requested a lot.  Her business helps her to continue with her daily life, and it helps to cover the household expenses.

She wants to invest in her business.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, eggs, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients.  She will do this in order to be able to continue making the food that she sells.  This way she will continue with her business.

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.  With this she will be able to continue with her business plan.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, eggs, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Alexandra Carolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Alexandra vive en Guayaquil, Empezó hace tiempo cuando aprendió a elaborar sorpresas con fomix y se dio cuenta  que esta actividad es muy rentable ya que la inversión es mínima, a parte hace mucho tiempo atras planeaba en abrir un negocio de fomix. Este trabajo lo realiza sola todos los días desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 de la tarde. 

No tiene ninguna  dificultad. No está casada, es soltera pero tiene dos hermosas hijas que estudian en la escuela fiscal. Y sola trata de sacar a sus hijas adelante y que a ellas no les haga falta nada.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar lamparas, fomix, pinturas etc. EL sueño que quiere en el futuro es poder abrir un local de productos para fiestas infantiles y seguir proporcionando ya que también tiene otro ingreso. y así poder tener mejores ganancias y tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Sra. Alexandra lives in Guayaquil. Some time ago, she began learning to make party favors out of craft foam. She found out that this type of business is very profitable from a minimal investment. After a great deal of time, she planned to open a craft foam business. Alexandra works by herself every day from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.

She is not experiencing any difficulties. Alexandra is not married, but she has two beautiful daughters who are studying at a state school. She alone tries to help her daughters move forward and see that they lack nothing. With this loan, she will buy lights, craft foam, paint, and other supplies. Her dream for the future is to open a shop that sells children’s party products so that she can have another source of income. This will enable her to have better earnings and improved well-being.

loans.use: to buy lights, craft foam, paints, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old now, married with children. Her spouse contributes to the family income. She has been running the business for a period of about three years with an income of KES. 45,000 a month.The business is doing well.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans. She wants to use the loan to buy more hair products and a dryer.

She hope to invest in other businesses that will enable her family to access basic needs with ease.

loans.use: To buy hair products and a dryer.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 49-year-old fisherman from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. 

Antonio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and ropes. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business thus augmenting his catch.

In the future, Antonio has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and ropes

loans.name: Leomaldy

texts.es: Leomaldy de 50 años habita con su cónyuge y es madre de familia de jóvenes que se encuentran en las edades de 19 a 28 años. Desde hace 1 año inició su experiencia emprendedora con el fin de mejorar los ingresos de su hogar y darle un mayor bienestar. Ella inició una actividad comercial a través de la cual vende útiles escolares, artículos de papelería, fantasía bolsos artículos de aseo y perfumería.  Diariamente inicia sus servicios desde las 9 de la mañana llegando a extenderse hasta las 9 de la noche, dependiendo de las necesidades de su clientela, especialmente en las temporadas de picos altos en sus ventas, las cuales hace de contado y a crédito. Su meta es aumentar su capital d e trabajo, para tener siempre una liquidez que le permita exhibir los inventarios que mas rotan y con los que muchas veces no cuenta en su estantería. Esta es la razón principal para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el cual planea comprar útiles escolares, calzado y perfumería. Su inversión se hará exitosa porque cuenta con una demanda permanente en el merado educativo y su experiencia la direcciona hacia el logro de su propósito de venta.
texts.en:
Leomaldy is 50 years old, and she lives with her husband.  She has children between the ages of 19 and 28.  She started her entrepreneurial experience one year ago.  She did this in order to improve the household income and to give the household greater well-being.

She started a business activity of selling school supplies, stationery goods, costume jewelry, purses, toiletries, and perfume.  She starts her services daily from nine in the morning, and she works up until nine at night, depending on the customers’ needs.  She especially works these hours during high sales seasons, and she sells for cash and on credit.

Her goal is to increase her working capital in order to always have liquidity.  This will allow her to display the inventory that turns over the most, which she often does not have on her shelf.

This is the main reason for applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to use the loan to buy school supplies, shoes, and perfume.  Her investment will be successful because there is a constant demand in the educational market.  Also, her experience guides her towards achieving her sales goal.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, shoes, and perfume.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas se encuentra en el 1ciclo, donde todas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también se desarrolla  actividades en forma conjunta, se ayudaran mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar  a sus familias 
Una historia es la de la Sra. Lorena quien se dedica a la venta de aceite, harina, azúcar y carne para hacer empanada y milanesa, picadillo, jabón en polvo,   y verduras en general, que ella misma trae de la otro país;  la meta de Lorena es poder mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró pero quiere seguir esforzándose para crecer más.
Ella solicita del crédito para la compra de  aceite, harina, azúcar y carne, con lo que podrá seguir sus ventas y poder cumplir así cualquier pedido de sus clientes. En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas ya que en el grupo hay mujeres que no estan solicitando crédito, pero que ayudan a sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas (Women United) communal bank is in its first loan cycle. All the women work together in the program. In addition to their individual activities, they also work together. They mutually help each other to reach their goals, which are working to support their families. One story is that of Lorena, who works selling oil, flour, sugar, and meat to make empanadas and milanesa (breaded cutlets), picadillo (a dish with ground beef and tomatoes), detergent, and vegetables, which she herself brings from another country. Lorena's goal is to improve her work, her living conditions, and her income. She says that through this business, the household economy has improved, but she wants to keep working to grow more. 
She is asking for the loan to buy oil, flour, sugar, and meat, with which she will be able to continue with her sales and meet any orders from her customers.  There are extra people in the photo because there are women in the photo that aren't asking for credit, but that help the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, sugar, and meat.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está trabajando junto y gracias a ese trabajo ya está en su tercer ciclo. Son 14 mujeres que están ayudándose las unas a las otras y luchan por sus familias y por sus hijos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Digna, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Digna cuenta que se dedica a la venta de perfumes, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan para poder salir adelante y que no les falte nada.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mas perfumes y cremas para el cuerpo, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is working together in its third loan cycle thanks to that work.  They are 14 women who help each other and strive for their families and their children.

One of the members is Digna, who showed a poverty level of two in her last survey.  Digna says she makes a living selling perfume, and that thanks to her job she's giving her family everything they need to get ahead and not lack anything.

She's requesting this loan to buy more perfume and body lotion.  This will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy perfume and body lotion

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bunghokho  in the Mbale  region of Uganda. She is married  and has one child. For the past five years, Jane  has been working hard to manage her produce stand where she trades in beans, flour and maize. 

To help expand her business, Jane  has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and buy more maize flour and beans to sell. That will help Jane  to generate greater profits and more income. Jane  hopes that in the future she will be able to attain a better standard of living. 

Jane  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to improve her business and buy more maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is a responsible mother who was gifted with five children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living and educate their children. As a way of generating income, she runs a small variety store in their village. She aims to make the business viable and profitable in order to earn sufficient income to support the education of her children. She planned to acquire more stocks of commodities to sell but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, beverages, snack foods, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. Through her patience and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, beverages, snack foods, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tapan

texts.en:
Tapan is a 24-year-old physically challenged person. He is unmarried. He lives with his parents and siblings. He has a small variety store in his village. He sells food items like rice, lentils, pickles, salt, wafers, chocolates, spices, etc. He has to travel every three days to the nearest market in town to get more stock. He wants to reinvest in his variety store so that he can stock up on inventory at his shop to meet the demand of the local people and reduce his transportation and buying cost. This will increase his earning capacity.

Tapan has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase more items of what he is selling right now and add more variety to his product line and more stock of the goods for his variety shop so he can grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice, lentils, pickles, salt, wafers, chocolates, spices, etc., for his variety shop.

loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
MARICELA tiene 31 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en la ciudad  de CHimbo Provicnia de Bolívar.

MARICELA se dedica a la venta de carne por libras. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar animales para poder vender. 

 Las compras las realizará en Chimbo. El sueño es incrementar las ventas y conocer a alguien especial para contraer matrimonio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar cartas.
texts.en:
MARICELA is 31 years old, single and has no children.  She lives with her father in the city of Chimbo, within the Bolivar province.

MARICELA sells meat by the pound.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy pigs.  This loan will help her buy animals that she can sell. 

She makes her purchases in Chimbo.  Her dreams are to increase her sales and to meet someone special so she can get married.

She likes to play cards in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gisella

texts.es: Gisella una joven de 25 años tiene una variedades ubicada en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar donde habita. Allí vende directamente a sus consumidores, que son  estudiantes, vecinos del pueblo, de contado y con una frecuencia diaria desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.  Su meta mas adelante es trasladar su negocio hacia un local amplio e independiente   y  conformar su hogar  además de adquirir su vivienda. En la actualidad planea incrementar sus ventas inyectando capital de trabajo a su negocio, pero para sus expectativas de crecimiento su  propios ingresos no alcanzan; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará libretas, lápices, carpetas, plastilina libros etc. Con ello planea tener mas liquidez lograr oportunidades de descuentos en las compras y vender a un precio competitivo, lo cual es muy efectivo para que su negocio ascienda en sus ventas y generar mayores posibilidades de ahorro, para tener un mayor bienestar.
texts.en:
Gisella is a 25-year-old young woman who has a store located in the town of Puerto Colombia, where she lives. She sells school and office supplies for cash, directly to her customers, who are students and townspeople. She is open daily from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

Her goal for the future is to move her business into a large, independent space and also form a family, as well as buy a home. She currently wants to increase her sales by injecting working capital into her business, but she doesn't have enough income to fulfill her growth expectations. That is why she has turned to a Kiva loan, which is her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy notebooks, pencils, folders, clay, books, etc. This way she plans to have more liquidity and the opportunity to make purchases at a discount, while selling at a competitive price. This will be very effective for her business to increase sales and generate better opportunities to save, so that she can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, folders, clay, books, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La Señora Marcelina  tiene 53 años, está casada desde hace 30 años con el señor Luis de 64 años, con quien no tuvo ningún hijo, pero llegaron a adoptar cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya se casaron y viven en forma independiente y otras dos están viviendo con ellos.
La Sra. Marcelina tiene una despensa desde hace 8 años, empezó con la ayuda de su marido que tiene cultivo de productos agrícolas  y con su ganancia empezaron el negocio que ahora le sirve para cubrir los gastos familiares y del estudio.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de fideos, harina, aceites, yerba, galleta, mandioca, bebidas , golosinas, que es lo que mas vende en su negocio,  así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ingresos.-
texts.en:
Marcelina is 53 years old and for the last 30 years has been married to her husband Luis, who is 64.  They did not have any biological children, but they were able to adopt four children.  Two of the children are now married and living independently, and they other two still live at home.

She has had a grocery store for eight years.  She started with the help of her husband, who used his earnings from growing crops to help start the business.  The income from this business now covers the household expenses as well as school fees.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, tapioca, cookies, candy and drinks, which are the top-selling items in her business.  This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and allow for the possibility of increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, oil, herbs, tapioca, cookies, candy, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Santisima Cruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (Santísima Cruz) está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, las quince se encuentran trabajando para mejorar sus vidas, y de esa forma también poder dar a sus familias una vida digna.
Un ejemplo de lucha es la Sra. Gladys, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa y con ello ayuda a su familia y tiene los medios para darles lo que necesitan. Es una persona muy trabajadora que pese a los problemas del día a día ha podido sobrellevarlos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlos en la compra de verduras, lácteos, bebidas, carnes y demás insumos, ya que con eso podrá seguir con sus ventas y su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
Santísima Cruz (Holy Cross) is a group currently working the first cycle of the women Committee’s program. These fifteen women are working to improve their lives in order to succeeding in granting a dignified life to their families.
Gladys is an exemplary fighter: she runs a small and well-furnished store located in her house, and thanks to this activity she helps her family by providing them with what they need. She is a very hardworking woman who has succeeded in enduring and facing her daily difficulties.
She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, dairy products, soft drinks, meat and other articles, as through this purchase she will succeed in carrying her activity out as well as in carrying on with the plans she has for her activity.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, dairy products, soft drinks, meat.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Santa Ana es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es un grupo que se ha esforzado por trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras, gracias al trabajo que todas hacen ya están en su tercer ciclo, también  se debe destacar que este grupo están por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rocio, quien nos comenta que se dedica a las ventas varias, tiene todo tipo de productos, los cuales vende y con ello ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona que lucha por Salir adelante y mostrar así que con esfuerzo y sacrificio si se puede.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas, verduras, cosméticos, perfumes, ropas etc.  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, y así también seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santa Ana is from the city of San Lorenzo and is a group where its members have made an effort to work together and help one another.  Thanks to the work they all do, they are in their third cycle.  We must also emphasize that this group is below the poverty line.

Rocio is one of the members and tells us that she has various types of products, which she sells and helps her family in this way.  She is a persons who works hard to get ahead and her effort and sacrifice shows that she can.

She is asking for this loan to buy fruits, vegetables, cosmetics, perfumes, clothing, etc. which will help her to solidify her business plan and help her improve her income.  In this way she can continue to provide a good selection for her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Saul

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Saúl vive en Managua capital de Nicaragua, es trabajador activo de una universidad privada donde labora de auxiliar de nomina desde hace un año, su estado civil casado con tres hijos a su cargo y su esposa es ama de casa que se queda al cuido de los niños con edad escolar.
