location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nelly Romelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelly vive en Guayaquil, tiene 44 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio con la venta de encebollado (Plato tipico en los desayunos que se hace con pescado y yuca) y como se dio cuenta que le iba muy bien y lo que hacía le gustaba se quedo hasta la actualidad con la venta de encebollado. Y así genero más ingresos para sus gastos.

Ella trabaja sola todos los días desde las 3:00 de la tarde hasta las 4:00 de la tarde solo una hora ya que la venta es muy buena los encebollados se le terminan rápido.

No está casada, ni tampoco tiene hijos ella prefiere vivir sola así lo que gana lo utiliza para comprar sus propias cosas.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescado, yuca, especies para hacer mas platos. Su sueño es poder tener una sucursal más amplia donde venda almuerzos y meriendas ya que en el local no hay mucha competencia y eso le favorece para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly, age 44, lives in Guayaquil. She started a business of selling “encebollado” (a traditional breakfast dish that is made with fish and cassava). Nelly did very well and discovered that she enjoyed the work, so she continues to sell “encebollado” to this day. She is able to generate more income for her expenses.

Nelly works alone every day from 3:00 P.M. to 4:00 P.M. Even though she is open for only for one hour, her sales are very good since her dish runs out quickly. Nelly is not married and has no children. She prefers to live alone, so whatever she earns is used to buy her own things.

With this loan, Nelly wants to buy fish, cassava, and spices so that she can produce more dishes. Her dream is to have a larger location where she can sell lunches and snacks. In her current location, there is not much competition, so she is able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fish, cassava, and spices.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer who grows rice on six hectares of farmland and resides in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province, Chanry is 43 and a mother of four kids. Nowadays, only one daughter still relies on her, as she is still in school. For Chanry, her agriculture activity is the only business that she has been with for 20 years. 

Chanry is an eight-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past loans wisely to sustain her living and her businesses better than before. Due to the low crop yield of last year's rice cultivation, she wants to apply for a new loan to replant her rice. 

Therefore, she formed a group of two. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and gasoline for pumping water to her farmland. She hopes these purchases will help her to recover her losses and boost her productivity to a high scale and bring her double income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and gasoline.

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old local farmer originally from Battambang Province, Norm is married and blessed with six children, one of whom is still in school. The primary source of income is from one hectare of sesame growing, and secondary income is from a pig raising business. Her husband is a barber in the local area and also uses his spare time to support both businesses. The current business, which she has been engaged in for 10 years, provides her with about 26,300 KHR per day. 

Norm has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles. She has succeeded in using her past loans in an effective way to upgrade her living. Now, she wants to expand her pig-raising business, so she formed a group of three to seek a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy four more pigs for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition so that she can sell them for a high price and make double income for her children’s sake.

loans.use: To buy four more pigs for raising.

loans.name: Sokneagn's Group

texts.en: Sokneang, a peasant who grows cassava on two hectares of farmland, is a young mother of two schoolchildren, age 27 years old. To supplement the family’s income, she also sells sugarcane juice in the local area. With 10 years' involvement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 28,500 riels per day. She is in her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After her past loans, which she fully repaid, she feels empowered to relieve her family’s burden and sustain her living. Now, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava farmland. She highly hopes this purchase will increase her crop yield and bring in a good income for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava farmland

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: Musabye est vice présidente du groupe Mizeituni, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 48 ans et mère de 7 enfants sont 4 étudient. Son conjoint est sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires (haricots). Elle installe ses produits dans un petit entrepôt. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle commença avec le crédit de base de Hekima. L’insécurité dans le site d’approvisionnement constitue une impasse pour le développement de son activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettre de payer 6 sacs d’haricots. Ainsi, la cliente remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.
texts.en:
Musabye is the vice president of the Muzeituni group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, is 48 years of age, and has seven children, four of whom are at school. Her spouse is currently unemployed. She works selling food supplies (beans), and sells her produce in a small warehouse. 

Musabye has been working in this business for three years. She started with the basic Hekima loan. The lack of security with regard to her supply area has been a barrier to development for her business. This new loan will allow her to buy six sacks of beans. Musabye thanks Hekima for the financial support given to her.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of beans.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ouch's Group

texts.en:
An elderly mother of four kids, Ouch is a farmer who grows rice on a two-hectare area to tackle the family’s daily hardships. This single business, with which she has been for 10 years, has returned her about 19,300 KHR per day. 

Ouch is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The prior loans enabled her to uplift her lifestyle and gradually improve her livelihood. Now, she is in a group of two. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay labor fees. She hopes to gain a better yield than last year and maximize her profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Srea's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, 55-year-old Srea is married and has eight children. Nowadays, she needs to support six children as they are still students in the local state school. For this big family’s sake, she earns a living by growing rice and cassava. Her husband helps her and earns additional income from a job.

Engaged in her current business for several years, and earning about 23,000 KHR per day, Srea has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. including this one, and feels confident that she can keep up a good working pace and continue to live in harmony. As the leader of this group of four, Srea will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, labor costs, and fertilizer for her cash crops. She hopes to grow her crops fruitfully and in a timely manner so that she can improve her lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, labor costs, and fertilizer for her cash crops.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Sitha, age 43, lives with her husband and two children in a village in the province of Banteay Meanchey in the Moungkol Borey district. To earn a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for nearly 15 years; they supplement the family’s income by fishing. The current business enables her to earn about 18,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sitha is now leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fishing materials for her husband’s business. She hopes to catch more fish so they can sell them at a good price and better their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her husband’s business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza  está en su ciclo 4. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza. En la foto del grupo aparecen 14 mujeres, ya que una de ellas no retira crédito, pero forma parte de este grupo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a las ventas. Tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida con todos los productos que sus vecinos necesitan. Siempre trata de tener todo para que ellos se sientan a gusto y sigan yendo a su local. Gracias a su trabajo Maria ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para poder tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lácteos, panificados, verduras, y demás insumos para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio y de esa forma dar a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The group “La Esperanza” (The Hope) is in its fourth loan cycle. The members are also taking a poverty elimination survey. Through their continued work and efforts, they apply the important behaviors needed to become successful women. As a result, they have improved their situations in terms of poverty. The photo shows 14 women. One of them is not participating in the loan, but she is still part of the group.

One of these women is Sra. Maria. She generates sales from a small food pantry that is well-stocked with all types of products that her neighbors need. Maria tries to keep everything they like on hand so that they will continue to visit her shop. Thanks to her work, Maria is able to help her family and provide everything they need to have a decent life and not feel deprived.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, and other items so that she can continue to restock her business. This will enable her to offer her customers the variety of items that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme âgée de 51 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 2 enfants âgés de 30 et 27ans. Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1991. Elle revend des œufs pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé, Vogan et Djagble. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés. Akoua a requis son 2nd crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des œufs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Akoua is a 51 year old woman. She is a widow, and the mother of two children aged 30 and 27. She has been working as a re-seller since 1991, selling eggs to clients in their homes. She purchases her products in Lomé, Vogan et Djagble. She currently has no difficulties with this business. Akoua is asking for her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase more eggs. She hopes to use the profits to reinvest in her business, and someday open a storefront, but her first priority is to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: purchase eggs

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Age 59 and a citizen from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang Province, Leap is a mother of six children. Currently, only one schoolchild still counts on her. To add to the family’s income, her husband works at construction sites besides helping on the farmland. Farming is the business that Leap has been with for 34 years. 

She is a four-cycle client with VisionFund. She has used her past loans wisely in order to support her business and to provide a decent income to cover the cost of meals three times a day. Now, her current income is up to about 35,300 KHR per day. 

Now, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay plowing fees and a water pumping fee. She hopes to earn more income from her current business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay plowing fees and a water pumping fee.

loans.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeurn, a 51-year-old mother of four kids, is a farmer who makes a living through a rice farming business. Her husband works for others for a fee to make extra income and to help his wife deal with the family’s financial hardship. After 15 years of being engaged in the current business, Chamroeurn is able to earn up to 23,300 KHR per day. After offsetting other expenses, she is able to save up to 6,400 KHR per day. 

This is not the original loan for Chamroeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With a positive impact on her living conditions, she feels confident that she can maintain this livelihood in a gradual manner. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. She formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide, and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to grow her cash crop on time and receive a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide, and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Pol's Group

texts.en:
A rice grower originally from Banteay Meanchey province, Pol is 47 years old and married. She is blessed with five children (three schoolchildren and two paid-workers). Her current business returns her about 23,700 KHR per day. Pol is in the fourth cycle and formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which she utilized wisely to better support her business. 

Now, she is seeking 300,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Pol will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to double her income so she can sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Moern, age 48, lives in a rural village in the Kror Kor district. She has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She has been engaged in farming rice and planting vegetables to make a living for 10 years. 

Moern’s group consists of two female members who are fourth cycled clients with VisionFund. The past two loans, which Moern completely repaid, have helped her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Moern, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a proper house in which to live.

loans.use: To renovate her old house.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, age 37, is married and has one son. He lives with his wife in a rural village in the district of Thmor Koul, which is in the province of Battambang in Cambodia. He earns a living by working as a policeman and supplements his income through planting vegetables. He earns about 16,000 KHR per day.  

Sopheap’s group consists of three members who live in the same area; he is the first cycled client. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Sopheap  will use his portion to buy a motorbike. He hopes this loan will enable him to buy a proper motorbike for his family to use.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoern is a 31-year-old mother of three living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. All of her children are in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been selling grocery items for 11 years.

Sokhoern has been with VisionFund for seven cycles, while the other group members have received from two to three loans. The past loans have helped Sokhoem relieve her family’s financial burden, and now, as leader this group of three, she is requesting a new loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in an apartment in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband Enh-Olzii, age 42, works at a mining company. Her sons Suhbat, age 17, and Suhbold, age 8, go to local schools. 

The borrower has been running her traditional boot-making business for seven years. She has gained lot of experience and regular customers over the years, and she is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of leather and organic felt to produce traditional boots to sell to her customers. She is hardworking, welcoming and a friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of leather and organic felt to produce traditional boots to sell

loans.name: Sreyleab's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleab, a fish vendor from Banteay Meanchey province, is 28 years old and has two children. To add more income for the family’s sake, her husband also raises pigs and tailors clothes. Farming is the business that Srealeab has been engaged in for five years. 

She is a second time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loan enabled her to progressively support her living as well as her business. Now, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy three more pigs for raising and to buy fish for resale. She hopes to earn more income so that she can expand her business to a bigger scale.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs for raising and to buy fish for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Vinh, age 47, is from a rural village located in the district of Thmor Koul, which is in the province of Battambang. She is married with one child. She earns a living through raising pigs; her husband supplements their income by working as a taxi driver. 

Vinh’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which helped her family get enough food. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed as well as household supplies. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and household supplies.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han is 57 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one child in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district in Cambodia. She has been growing cassava crops for 20 years. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her business.

This is the seventh loan for Han with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her cassava crops and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s earnings and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her cassava crops.

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluunbat is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife Hishigtsetseg, age 39, works at a local company as an agriculturalist. His children (Baymbahorol, age 18, and son Baasanbayar, age 9) go to local schools.

The borrower has been running various businesses since 1990 and started his taxi service business in town in 2006. His wife is now starting her own business of organic vegetable growing on their plot of land and he is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase seeds and soils to let his wife start an organic vegetable growing and sales business. Both borrower and his wife are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soils to let his wife start an organic vegetable growing and sales business

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunh is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 2 sons in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Odonchimeg, age 33, works at a local kindergarten as an assistant teacher. His sons Uuganbayar, age 11, and Magnaibayar, age 6, go to a local school.

Batmunh has started working at auto repair service business in 2000 and has been operating business himself since 2003. He has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory to run his business smoothly with no sudden pause. He is a hardworking, responsible and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run his business smoothly with no sudden pause

loans.name: Uulbala

texts.ru: Уулбала 50 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Уулбала работает в больнице в качестве курьера. Дополнительно работает уборщицей в двух организациях. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода  Уулбала начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве в 1994 году начав этот бизнес с 10,000 KGS. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Уулбала насчитывается 2 дойные коровы. Также она выращивает фасоль на 2,0 га земли, урожай Уулбала продает на местных рынках. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулбала повторно обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 4 нетелей. Доходы Уулбала планирует вкладывать на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Uulbala is 50 years old, married, and raised four children. Uulbala works in a hospital as a courier. Additionally, she works as a cleaner in two organizations. 

As an additional source of income, Uulbala began her own business raising animals and crops in 1994, starting the business with 10,000 KGS. Today, Uulbala has on her farm two dairy cows. She also grows beans on 2.0 hectares of land. Uulbala sells the harvest at the local market. 

In order to further develop her business, Uulbala repeatedly turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and four heifers. 

Uulbala plans to invest income to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase four heifers and a cow

loans.name: Ana Elia

texts.es: Ana Elia, una joven de 24 años de edad, no cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres ya que ellos fallecieron y ella se las ha tenido que ingeniárselas con su trabajo como responsable de farmacia en un hospital para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, pero sus ingresos son muy bajos los que no le permite realizar de un solo pago los gastos del curso de titulación, por lo que ella solicito financiamiento para lograr pagar este curso tan importante para su formación profesional, agradece a Kiva por apoyar a estudiantes de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Ana Elia is a young woman who is 24 years of age. She does not have the support of her parents since they are deceased. Through her initiative, she currently works as the head of a hospital pharmacy. This enables her to pay for her university studies, but her income not enough. She is not able to make a single payment toward her course fees.

For this reason, Ana Elia is requesting a loan so that she can pay for a course that is vital for her professional development. She is grateful to Kiva for supporting low-income students.

loans.use: to pay for a university course.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a 'ger' in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband Tsog, age 55, works part-time providing handyman services in town. Her son Oyunbaatar works at a local hospital and her daughter Otgonjargal studies at a local school. 

The borrower has been doing interior redesign work during the summer with her husband and part-time tailoring clothes to order. She is now making her tailoring business her real business and needs an additional investment of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and tools to produce traditional costumes and sell them to local customers. She is hardworking, positive and a well-organized woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and tools to produce traditional costumes

loans.name: Saleap's Group

texts.en:
Saleap is a 50-year-old widowed mother of three children. She is originally from a village in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to make a living. For the past ten years, Saleap has worked as a corn farmer which is the main source of her family's income. She and her children also work for others for a fee and sell snacks in a village. Saleap  currently earns about 20,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Saleap is the leader of a group loan composed of two members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. She will use her portion of the loan to buy seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer and to pay labor costs. Saleap successfully repaid her previous loans. In the future, she hopes to increase her income and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке в селе Ново-Водяное уже 25 лет. Она – замужем, у нее двое взрослых детей. Доход с огорода составляет около 90 000 гривен. Ирина выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис, капусту и перец. 
Ирина планирует использовать средства, полученные от КИВА, в размере 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, полиэтиленовую пленку, удобрения и сделать ремонт теплицы, которая пострадала от снегопада. В этом году дочь вышла замуж, семья потратилась на свадьбу, поэтому теперь им не хватает собственных средств на хозяйство. Со временем Ирина надеется поставить еще две теплицы, так как у нее еще есть много свободной земли.
texts.en:
Irina has been engaged in growing vegetables on her plot of land in the village of Novovodyanoye for 25 years. She is married and has two grown children. Income from the garden is about 90,000 hryvnia. Irina grows tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, cabbage, and peppers. 

Irina plans to use the funds received from Kiva, in the amount of 24,000 hryvnia, to buy seeds, plastic sheeting, and fertilizers, and to make repairs on her greenhouses that were stricken by snowfall. This year, her daughter is getting married and the family will spend on the wedding, so now they do not have  the funds for the farm. Over time, Irina hopes to put up two more greenhouses, as she still has a lot of available land.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plastic sheeting, and fertilizer; and to make repairs on her greenhouses that were stricken by snowfall

loans.name: Dúo Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
DUO TEJEDORAS
ESTE DUO ESTA CONFORMADO POR DOÑA MARIA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES TIPICOS Y DE MARCADOR Y LOS GUIPILES QUE ELABORA ESTAN YA ENCAGADOS POR SUS CLIENTAS QUIENES LA BUSCAN PARA COMPRAR SU PRODUCTOS. ESPERA QUE FAPE LA AYUDE OTORGANDOLES EL CREDITO YA QUE LO SOLICITAN PARA LA COMPRA DE HILOS Y TELAS PARA BORDAR.
texts.en: This group “Tejedoras” (Weavers) includes Doña Maria, who makes both traditional and brand-name garments.  The clothes that she makes are requested by customers who are looking to buy her products.  She hopes FAPE will assist her by providing her with the loan she requested.  Maria will buy thread and fabrics for her weaving.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional woven garments.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia de 20 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora que tras haber terminado su bachillerato, decidió dedicarse a laborar para pagarse sus estudios universitarios. Cuenta que su hermano le cedió un carro de comidas rápidas en el cual trabaja diariamente de cuatro de la tarde a una de la  mañana y en el día se dirige a la universidad.
“nadie ha dicho que estudiar y trabajar se una tarea fácil, pero para alcanzar los sueños a veces toca sacrificarse”. Estas son las palabras de Natalia quien siente que sus luchas no son infructuosas y que pronto verá la recompensa a su esfuerzo. 
Natalia se siente satisfecha con su trabajo ya que al laborar como independiente tiene grandes ventajas como el manejo del tiempo. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido y mejoras locativas- adecuación del piso y el techo de su local y compra de silletería- con el propósito de brindar un mejor servicio.
Espera poder mejorar su situación económica e incrementar las ventas en su negocio para poder terminar su universidad.
texts.en:
After completing high school, 20-year old Natalia, a young entrepreneur, decided to get a job to pay for university. She explains that her brother gave her a fast food stall where she works every day from 4 pm to 1 am. During the day she attends university.

“No one ever said that studying and working would be easy,” she says, “but to achieve your dreams, sometimes you have to make sacrifices.” Natalia feels that her efforts are not in vain and that soon she will be rewarded. She is happy with her job as working independently brings big advantages such as being able to manage her time.

She is now seeking a loan to buy more stock and make improvements to her business like renovating the floor and roof of her premises and buying some chairs, thus providing her customers with better service.

Natalia hopes to improve her economic situation and increase sales so that she can complete university.

loans.use: buy ingredients and chairs, and renovate the floor and roof of her premises

loans.name: Orfa Lia

texts.es:
Orfa de 60 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos. Debido a que su cónyuge la abandonó, se hizo cargo de los gastos del hogar y del bienestar de su familia. Desde hace 20 años montó su propio negocio ubicado en la troncal de corregimiento de Puerto Valdivia, Valdivia, Colombia, en donde ofrece servicio de comida y mecatos, principalmente para turistas. Labora diariamente de siete de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus ventas y para ello, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, con el propósito aumentar la preparación de alimentos. Orfa espera que con esta inversión sus ventas mejoren, logrando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Orfa, 60 years old, is a single mother of three children. Because her husband left her, she has been in charge of household expenses and the well-being of her family. For 20 years, she has established and worked in her own business, which is located in the heart of the small town of Puerto Valdivia, Valdivia, Colombia. Here, she offers food and dessert services, mainly for tourists. She works daily from seven in the morning until seven at night.

Her greatest dream is to improve her sales, which is why she is requesting a loan that will be used to buy staple food products. With this, she hopes to increase the amount of food she prepares. Orfa hopes that her sales will grow with this investment, allowing her family to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy staple food products

loans.name: Don's Group

texts.en:
Don is 58 years old and married with five children. He lives in a wooden house in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Don has been a rice farmer for 20 years and this is the main source of his family's income. He is able to earn about 18,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.  

Don is the leader of a three-member group loan. All of the members live in the same village. This will be his first loan cycle with VisionFund. Don will use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland and to plow his field. He hopes his loan will enable him to increase her rice crop to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen is a 49-year-old married father of two children, one of whom is dependent on him and still in school. He is originally from a village of the Dambae district where rice farming is a common way to make a living. Khen has been farming rice and cassava for almost 20 years and currently earns about 28,000 KHR per day to support his family.

Khen is the leader of a two-member group loan whose members are from the same village. This will be his first loan cycle with VisionFund. Khen will use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his rice and cassava farm. He hopes to get a high yield from his plantation so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his rice and cassava farm

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
A mother of a small little son and also a citizen from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Sambath  is a local farmer who grows rice as a primary source of income. She is 23 years old and started on the rice farm four years ago. The current business earns her about 28,200 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

With this new loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has fully repaid her loans with success and is able to support her business in a timely way. Now, she is seeking 610,000 KHR in order to buy wooden boards to fix her house. She hopes this loan will help her to renovate her house on time so she can run a small grocery store at her house to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy wooden board to fix her house

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a local villager living in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Mean Chey province. She has five children, three of whom are still in school, whereas the remaining two are working as paid workers. To provide daily decent food for her children, she and her husband work for others for a fee. This is the only income generating activity that she has been with for 24 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Mao is a third-time borrower; she forms a group of two as the leader. For this loan cycle, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy zinc roof to cover her house as well as wooden board to renovate her house. She hopes to own a proper house for her children so that she does not have to worry about home conditions and can pay more attention to earning more income for her family, especially for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy zinc roof to cover her house as well as wooden board to renovate her house.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of two children originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham, Phy is 42 years old. She manages cassava farmland as her primary source of income and works for others for a fee to deal with the family’s basic needs. She has been involved in the current business for 20 years and she is able to earn up to 16,100 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Phy is in her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans, which have supported her business in a gradual manner and increased her income. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 2,000,000 KHR each in order to pay plowing fees and weeding fees, and to buy insecticide for her cash crop. She hopes to double her income for her family.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and weeding fees.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Аъзам,  мужчина в возрасте 50 лет. Проживает в городе Канибадам.  Он женат и имеет троих детей.  Супруга его нигде не работает, домохозяйка. Сам Аъзам работает плотником.  Занимается оказанием услуг по ремонту жилища – все то, что касается изготовления мебели , дверей, потолков и т.д. 

Он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Ему очень тяжело , так как цены на все поднялись. Трудится Аъзам  и в выходные дни, так как хочет чтобы его дети ни в чем не нуждались, он хочет дать то, чего не было у него в детстве. Планирует выучить своих детей , чтобы они работали по специальности.  

Аъзам запрашивает  кредит  на закупку сырья для изготовления изделий. Он кредитуется в Арванде с 2011 года  и не никогда не нарушал условия кредитования. Надеется,что кредит в очередной раз ему поможет и он сможет накопить денег на учебу своих детей.
texts.en:
Azam is 50 years old and lives in Kanibadam.  He's married and has 3 children.  His wife doesn't work outside of the home.  He himself works as a carpenter.  He makes repairs to homes and provides services with everything involving furniture manufacturing, doors, ceilings, etc.  

He is the sole provider for the family.  It is difficult for him because the prices have increased.  Azam works hard on the weekends too, as he wants to be able to give his children what they need, he wants to give what he's missed in his childhood. He plans to teach his kids to work in specialized fields.  

Azam is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for manufacture.  He has been a borrower with Arvand since 2011 and has never violated the terms of his contract.  He hopes that this loan will help him again and that he will be able to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mkono Mkononi Group

texts.fr: Furaha est présidente du groupe Mkono Mkononi, entrepreneur courageuse, mère de 12 enfants, dont 7 étudient. Son conjoint est un maçon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse de boisson locale. Elle commença avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il y a 15 ans, que cette cliente exerce cette activité. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir de payer les intrants de production (farine de manioc, maïs, bois de chauffage, sorgho, etc.). Parfois, cette cliente connait des méventes suite à une mauvaise solution de produits.  La cliente souhaite acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en: Furaha is the president of the lending group Mkono Mkononi, a courageous entrepreneur, and the mother of 12 children, 7 of whom attend school. Her husband is a mason builder. She has been selling local drinks for the past 15 years, a business that she began with financing from her husband. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase the necessary goods needed to create the drinks (manioc flour, corn, wood for fueld, sorghum, etc). She sometimes has difficulty selling her drinks due to a poorly developed product. She hopes to purchase a plot of land and ensure all of her children are educated. She is very thankful to Hekima's support in helping her achieve these goals.

loans.use: purchase the necessary goods needed to create local drinks (manioc flour, corn, wood for fueld, sorghum, etc)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 54, is a peasant from Pursat. She is a mother of four children and also a widow. She has managed three kinds of cash crops, including cashews, jackfruit and peanuts. This is the business that she has been engaged in for seven years, and it returns her about 28,800 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. From this income, she can save about 8,200 KHR per day after deducting expenses. 

Now, she is in the third loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans have provided her sufficient working capital to support her business in a timely manner. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. In this cycle, she will use her loan portion to buy cashews from other plantations for resale. Moreover, she will use some portion of her loan to buy peanut seeds for replanting. She hopes to earn more income from her current business and expand her cash-crop growing soon.

loans.use: To buy cashews from other plantations for resale.

loans.name: Ky's Group

texts.en:
Ky is a 42-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. All of her children are in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 22 years. They supplement their income by working for others for a fee. Ky's current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and used her previous loan to help relieve her family’s financial burden. 

Ky is the leader of a three-member group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy pesticide, seeds, and fertilizer for her cultivated land. Ky hopes to earn more income from her farm to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, seeds, and fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run, an inhabitant of Kampong Cham Province, is 32 years old and a widow, the mother of one school-age child. To confront the family’s hardships, she grows rice on two hectares of land, and she also works for others for pay. She has been engaged in her current business for ten years, and she is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. Run has not borrowed from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. She is applying for her first loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn a larger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is a 33-year-old farmer. She is a mother of a first and second grader and is from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. Neang grows rice on two hectares of farmland and raises three pigs. Her husband also works for other for a fee, shipping firewood. Neang's current business has enabled her to earn up to 15,000 KHR per day. She is a second-time borrower and used her previous loan to support her business. 

Neang is the leader of a two-person group loan. She is requesting a loan to buy wooden boards to build a new house for her family. She hopes to own a decent house for her little kids.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en: Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village in the Dambae District, Ya is 33 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice and cassava. Having been in this business for 13 years, she manages to earn about 14,000 KHR per day and can save about 7,000 KHR each day for future needs. This is a group loan for Ya’s Group of four borrowers who live in the same village. Ya is new to VisionFund with this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Ya wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava farm. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income, to improve her standard of living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Sareth is 38 years old and the mother of one schoolchild and another little kid. She is from Kampong Cham province. Sareth works as a rice and cassava farmer and has been a farmer for 18 years. She is a first-time borrower with the Kiva partner VisionFund.

Sareth is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide for her farm. She hopes that she can increase her yield and earn more income for her children’s sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, ella tiene 40 años de edad. Ella empezó vendiendo CD con su esposo de forma ambulante, pero el falleció con VIH Sida, ella fue saliendo adelante  con su local de CD, pero no era suficiente y más adelante llego a tener un restaurante, con el cual puede mantener a su familia.

A ella le dificulta su salud, ya que en ocasiones le a tocado estar hospitalizada. Ella es viuda, y tiene 2 hijos, de 19 y 20 años de edad. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar materia prima, sillas, meses, CD. etc.
 
Sus sueños para el futuro es que Dios le de vida y salud, darle lo mejor a sus hijos, tener un restaurante más grande y dar oportunidad a otras personas que tengan un empleo y no sean discriminados.
texts.en:
The client, age 40, lives in Guayaquil.  She started selling CDs in an itinerant manner with her husband.  However, he died with HIV/AIDS.  She was getting ahead with her CD place, but it was not enough.  Later on she came to have a restaurant with which she is able to support her family.

Her health is difficult for her because on occasion she has been hospitalized.  She is a widow, and she has two children, ages 19 and 20.  

She wishes to use the loan to buy items like chairs, tables, and CDs, etc.

Her dreams for the future are that God gives her life and health, to give her children the best, to have a bigger restaurant, and to give other people who do not have work an opportunity without discrimination.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.name: Yunia Patricia

texts.es:
Yunia de 26 años de edad, es una joven que ha tenido que buscar alternativas para salir adelante. Su familia es lo más importante para ella, por lo cual se ha esforzado por suministrarle su hijo de diez años de edad mejores condiciones de vida.
Gracias a la experiencia y con más de 11 años de trabajo en el sector se la confección, Yunia logró montar su propio taller con la ayuda de su padre quien le suministró los recursos para la adquisición de una máquina de coser. Con el desarrollo de esta actividad ha mejorado las condiciones económicas de su hogar. Hoy desea incrementar su capacidad de producción y mejorar su lugar de trabajo, a fin de generar mejores ingresos y garantizarle a su hijo una buena educación. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en  la compra de una vitrina, la cual usará para el almacenamiento de hilos y telas, a fin de mejorar el orden y el aspecto de su taller.
texts.en:
26-year old Yunia is a young woman who has had to look for opportunities in order to get ahead. Her family is the most important thing in her life so she has had to make a great effort to provide her 10-year old son with a better life.

Thanks to her experience and more than eleven years working as a seamstress, Yunia managed to acquire her own workshop with help from her father who gave her the money to buy a sewing machine. As the business developed, her finances improved. Today Yunia wishes to increase production and improve her premises so she can earn more money and guarantee her son a good education. She is seeking a loan to buy a display cabinet where she can store thread and fabric. This will make the workshop tidier and improve its appearance.

loans.use: buy a display cabinet

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Leap is 31 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are in school. She lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. For the past 13 years, Leap has been a farmer who grows rice on one hectare of farmland. This will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund.

Leap is the leader of a two-person group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay a water-pumping fee. Leap hopes to grow her rice timely and improve her yield to increase her profit to upgrade her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay a water-pumping fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem is 48 years old and the mother of five children. She is a local villager from the Dambe district of Kampong Cham Province. For the past 20 years, Saem has been growing cassava and raising pigs as the main source of her income. She is able to generate about 29,400 KHR per day. She has borrowed previously from the Kiva partner VisionFund. Saem used her loans to support her seasonal business and help provide a decent income.

Saem is the leader of a two-person group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to pay plowing and weeding fees, and to buy pesticide and pig feed. Saem hopes to grow her rice healthily and fatten her pig well to improve her income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to pay plowing and weeding fees and to buy pesticide and pig feed

loans.name: Doung's Group

texts.en:
Doung is 34 years old and married. She is blessed with two children who currently count on her as one is still in school and the other is still young. Doung is a rice and cassava farmer and has support from her husband. The couple also works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Doung is able to earn up to 19,800 KHR per day. She is a first-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia.

Doung is the leader of a two-person group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Doung hopes that she can improve her cassava yield and send all of her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Damaris De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Damaris, vive en la cuidad de Masaya, unas de las ciudades de Nicaragua con mucho calor humano, gente de tradición y cuna de artesanos, tiene la edad de 34 años, comerciante, su núcleo familiar es de 4 ella su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad. 

Su negocio consiste en la venta de cerdo frito, nacatamales, cabeza de chancho, moronga, pepena elaborados por ella misma, tiene dos años y 6 meses de poseer su propio negocio. 

Comenta que ella comenzó con capital propio producto de unos ahorros que tenia con su esposo, pero habiendo necesidades en el hogar de obtener mayores ingreso, decidió contribuir con su familia poniendo en su casa el negocio de venta de fritos, comida tradicional de la cuidad, derivadas del cerdo, sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas que transitan por la calle, para elaborarlo ella compra los insumos en el mercado municipal de la ciudad

En estos momentos esta necesitando invertir en su negocio para elaborar su producto en mayores cantidades y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes  que es mayor a lo que ella produce, todo este esfuerzo lo realiza con la intención de ser una persona productiva que contribuye a la mejoría de su hogar y al bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris lives in the city of Masaya.  Masaya is a Nicaraguan city with a lot of human warmth whose people maintain their traditions.  It is the birthplace of artisans.  Damaris is 34 years old and her nuclear family has four members: herself, her husband and her two dependent children.

Damaris' business is selling fried pork, tamales, 'cabeza de chancho' (a stew made from all the parts of a pig), 'moronga' (blood sausage) and pepena (cooked pork fat).  She prepares all of these dishes herself.  Damaris has owned her own business for two and a half years.  She says that she started the business with her own capital which she and her husband had saved up.  As she needed to make more income for her household, she decided to contribute toward her family's upkeep by setting up a fried food business in her own home.  She sells traditional food made from different parts of the pig and her customers are her neighbors and passersby.  She buys the ingredients she needs from the town market.

Right now, Damaris needs to invest in her business so that she can prepare her food in larger quantities and thereby satisfy her customer demand which currently exceeds what she is able to produce.  She is making all this effort as she wants to be a productive person who contributes toward improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, tamales, rice and pork rinds

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
Lon is a 32-year-old married mother of two school children and is originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is striving to overcome her family's hardships through growing crops (rice and cassava) and raising pigs, which provides her with a return of about 47,900 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. This income covers various necessary expenses of her family, especially her children’s education. 

Lon is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy a water pump for her cassava crop. She hopes to grow her cassava successfully and produce high yields  so that she can earn a higher income and  purchase additional farmland to expand her business activity.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for her cassava crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Erick Ramon

texts.es:
Erick es Originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte-Chinandega, Casado, trabajador, honesto, responsable, de buenas costumbres, dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia. 

 Actualmente se presentó a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito, para suplir el pago de la Matricula y Aranceles del primer semestre de su hijo mayor quien inicia la Universidad.
texts.en:
Erick is a native from the North San Francisco municipality in the department of Chinandega.

He is married, hard-working, honest, responsible, has good morals, and dedicated to his work and family.

Lately, he took part in CEPRODEL to request a loan to compensate for the first semester enrollment and tuition costs for his oldest son, who is just starting at the university

loans.use: to pay for his son's enrollment and tuition costs for the first semester at the university.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que mostró que 6 de las integrantes están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, ellas están trabajando arduamente y ponen todo de ellas por salir adelante y mejorar sus vidas.
Liz es una de las miembros, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de calzados, ya sea para hombres y caballeros y que por medio de este trabajo ella esta pudiendo mantener su hogar y darles lo que día a día necesitan, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Liz solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el cual es su fuente de ingresos y de ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Katupyry is conducting a survey for the elimination of poverty. It showed that 6 of the members are below the poverty line. The women are working hard and are doing everything to get ahead and improve their lives.

Liz is one of the members, and she earns her living selling all types of shoes, like men's shoewear. Because of this work, she is able to maintain her home, give her family what they need day to day, and do not have any times of need. She defines herself as a hard-working person, who, with effort, is getting ahead. 

Liz is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of all types of shoes. This way she can continue investing in her business which is her source of income and helps her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es:
Robinsón tiene 32 años de edad y se encuentra radicado en el municipio de Sonsón, Colombia en donde vive con su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. Debido a las dificultades económicas y a las pocas oportunidades de empleo, Robinson optó por montar su propio negocio y dedicarse al transporte de insumos agrícolas en un coche que heredó de su padre. 
Asegura que su caballo se ha convertido en su mejor amigo y la fuente de sustento para su hogar, por lo cual  lo cuida y vela por su bienestar como un miembro mas de su familia, ya que es conciente que es un ser que siente como todo ser humano. 
En la actualidad tiene su actividad suspendida ya que el coche se encuentra en malas condiciones por el deterioro ocasionado por el uso. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una nueva carrocería con el propósito de reactivar su actividad económica.
Su mayor sueño es poder garantizarle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
32-year old Robinsón lives in the municipality of Sonsón, Colombia, with his wife and three young children. Because of financial difficulties and few job opportunities, Robinsón decided to open his own business and earn his living transporting agricultural supplies in a cart that he inherited from his father.

He says that his horse has become his best friend and the source of the income he uses to support his family. For this reason he looks after the horse as if it were a member of his family. He knows that a horse is a creature with feelings just like a human being.

Currently Robinsón has had to stop work as the cart has broken down due to overuse, so he is seeking a loan to buy a new one and restart his business. His greatest dream is to be able to guarantee his children a better standard of living and a good education.

loans.use: Buy a new cart

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en: Chanthoeun is a mother of two who resides in Battambang province. She and her husband have been farming rice to support their family for many years. Chanthoeun is an old client of VisionFund and has been with them for seven loan cycles. She formed a group with another female member after paying off her sixth loan. As leader of the group, Chanthoeun requested the loan to spend on her rice field for activities such as land preparation. With this seventh loan, Chanhtoeun hopes to improve her crops so that she can sell them for a good price and her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To improve her rice farm

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson, de 47 años de edad, está casado con Miguelina con quien tiene 01 hija de 17 años de edad, juntos viven cómodamente su propia casa.Edson se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi el cual es fruto de sus esfuerzo y dedicación, siendo esta su herramienta de trabajo .  Se inicio en este rubro hace más de 15 años porque necesitaba una forma segura de obtener dinero ya que no podía conseguir un empleo fijo , ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus propios tiempos, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra tener buenos resultados, pero tiene como meta a largo plazo comprarse un vehiculo de transporte de carga pesada. Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos.
En está oportunidad solicitará S/.1500 soles, para la compra de repuestos de su mototaxi como llantas y accesorios, buscando de esa manera mantener operativo a su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Edson is 47 years old and married to Miguelina.  They have a 17 year old daughter and live comfortably in a home of their own.  Edson drives a moto-taxi, which is the fruit of his effort and dedication, being a tool of his trade.  He started in this field more than 15 years ago because he needed a way to make money since he was unable to find steady employment.  Now he feels more secure because he can manage his own time and be his own boss.  But he doesn’t like it when his moto-taxi breaks down because it costs him a lot of money, but he still manages to have good successes.  His long range goal is to buy a truck for hauling heavy freight.  This will be his third Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support he has that helps him reach his objectives.

He is asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN to be able to buy spare parts, such as tires and accessories for his moto-taxi, so that he can keep his vehicle running.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en: Nhorn is applying for her second loan from VisionFund. She applied for this loan after completely paying off her first. This time Nhorn is requesting $600 to renovate her house, as the family needs a proper place to live. She is 45 years old and has one daughter who is still in school. She is a worker at a local garment factory and her husband works on building houses. Together, they earn around $9 per day. This loan from VisionFund will help her family to have a good, clean place to live where they hope to have health and happiness.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuestra Esperanza está conformado por 8 integrante, madres solteras, con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. A pesar que en la vida han sufrido muchas adversidades, tienen sueños y metas, y ganas de superación como cualquier persona. Por lo tanto lucha diariamente para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

La coordinadora del banco  Nuestra Esperanza es Francisca Milagros, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña de tienda de productos comestibles que vende en cantidades pequeñas como sobres de café, sobre de shampoo, caja de fosforo, cigarrillos menudeados, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, sal. La rutina de trajo de Francisca es trabajar una 12 horas diaria ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido el medio de sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Nuestra Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Nuestra Esperanza Communal Bank is composed of 8 women, all single mothers who together have ten children in their care. All belong to the community of El Sauce which is located in the west part of the country. They are all hardworking, responsible, and with a great desire to get ahead. In spite of many difficulties, they have dreams and goals and aspirations like any person. For these reasons they work hard every day to provide a better future for their children.

Francisca Milagros is the bank coordinator. She earns her living running a ‘pulpería’ in her home. A pulpería is a corner store selling products in small quantities such as packets of coffee, shampoo, boxes of matches, cigarettes, rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, and salt. She works twelve hours a day serving customers in the store. It’s a job she enjoys as it has provided a way to support her family. Francisca is applying for a loan to use as working capital and buy stock so that she will soon be able to earn more money. 

The community bank Nuestra Esperanza is grateful for the funding provided by Kiva donors to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can work with dignity.

loans.use: Buy stock for her small store

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, 49, is from a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is widowed with six children. 

San earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for ten years. To better feed her family, she also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day.

This is San’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is a fifth-time borrower, while her co-member has been with VisionFund for eight years. As the leader, San is leading her group of two to apply for a loan.

San will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, San hopes to increase her family’s income so as to set aside some money to fulfill her dream of having a new house for living in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Soklay's Group

texts.en: Soklay was born in a village in the Ou Raing Ov district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Today, she is the 47-year-old mother of one daughter who works in a garment factory to better support her family. For the last 20 years, she has also owned a rice farm which is the family's main source of income. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs Soklay is requesting her first microloan from Kiva for the two-person loan group she leads. She will use her portion of the loan to pay the rent on her rice farm, and hopes to increase her income so that her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for rented land for a rice-farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Soriya's Group

texts.en: Soriya is 25 years old and lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, She and her husband have four children and must work hard to feed them. For the last five years, they have earned a living by farming and selling groceries. They earn about 30,000 KHR per day. Soriya has taken out five previous loans from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely repaid them all. Her most recent loan helped her improve her farmland, and she is now requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer to use on her farm and to plow her fields. She hopes to earn more income so that she can improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшану 33 года. Он женат и отец троих детей. Равшан со своей семьей живет в районе Шахритус, расположенного в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Равшан вместе с женой работает в дехканском хозяйстве (это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане). Равшан выращивает миндаль и земляной орех и продает их. Сейчас Равшан хочет заняться другой деятельностью. Его интересует животноводство, так как это прибыльное дело и к тому же климат его местности благоприятствует разведению скота. Равшан запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли он планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Ravshan is 33 years old and he is married with three children.  He lives with his family in the Shakhrituz region, which is located in the southwestern part of Tajikistan's Khatlon region, and he works with his wife in an orchard farm (a small individual or collective private farm on which a few people work, mainly growing cotton, wheat or vegetables - crops which account for 60% of the irrigated land in Tajikistan).  Ravshan grows almonds and ground nuts and he sells them.  He now wants to get started in cattle raising, as it is a profitable business and the climate in his region is conducive to breeding cattle.  Ravshan is asking for a loan to buy and sell cattle.  He plans to reinvest the income from this business into the purchase of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Dicmara

texts.es:
Dicmara, es Originaria del Municipio de Villanueva, Soltera, se caracteriza por ser una persona profesional habiendo obtenido el titulo de Licenciada en Literatura, honesta, respetuosa, se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria, con muchos deseos de superación. 

Actualmente esta iniciando una Maestría en Desarrollo Rural, por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para el pago de matricula y aranceles del primer trimestre.
texts.en:
Dicmara is from the Municipality of Villanueva. She is single, and is known as an honest, respectful, professional person. Dicmara has a Bachelor’s degree in Literature and works as a high school teacher. She has a strong desire to excel.

Dicmara is currently starting a Masters in Rural Development. She came to the CEPRODEL office to apply for a loan to pay for the tuition and fees for the first trimester.

loans.use: to pay the tuition and fees for her first trimester towards a Masters in Rural Development

loans.name: Maria Sydney

texts.en: Maria Sydney is 38 years old and has one child currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Maria Sydney runs a mobile phone re-loading business  in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase prepaid electronic load from the mobile service providers like Smart, Globe, Sun Cellular and other networks for retail. Maria Sydney has been in this business for 14 years. In the future Maria Sydney would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone electronic load for resale

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn, a 60-year-old mother of two children who are currently helping with the family’s business, is a rural villager from Kampong Cham Province, where rice farming is one of the common businesses for the villagers. Not different from her neighbors, she and her husband do rice cultivation. This is her only business and brings in about 19,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 9,000 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Yoeurn is in her seventh loan cycle. She has managed wisely to coordinate her business and household. Moreover, she can buy more household assets for personal consumption.

Now, Yoeurn has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions progressively.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store and room rentals. Violeta is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase supplies for her tailoring business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tonh's Group

texts.en:
Tonh is aged 47 years old and widowed. She lives with her six children in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. 

Tonh is a rice farmer of four hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 20 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Tonh with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on water pumping. 

Tonh hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Imm's Group

texts.en:
Imm is a 30-year-old mother of five children living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. Out of her five children, she still has four children to take care of. Some of her children are still in school and some help with the family’s business. 

To make a living, Imm and her husband have been working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Imm’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Imm will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

Imm hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling business of cosmetics and perfume products in the Philippines.

Edralyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Edralyn has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

In the future, Edralyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a boarding house business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Josephine requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her boarding house. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her boarding house

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, sticky rice, coconut milk, etc. for her food-vending business.

Josefina has been in this business for five years. Josefina earns more income from tailoring and pig fattening.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business like sugar, sticky rice, coconut milk, etc.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon is a 46-year-old mother of four children who are students. They live in Kampong Cham province. Yon struggles in earning a living with her husband to support the entire household through one hectare of rice farming and a half hectare of cassava growing. 

The 26 years of experience in the current business returns Yon about 19,000 KHR per day. This is her seventh cycle with VisionFund. She has succeeded in repaying back her past loan, which has better supported her to sustain her living. 

For this cycle, Yon formed a group of three to seek a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to lease an additional plot of farmland to expand her cash-crop growing. She hopes to receive a triple yield from her business and make a good profit for her children’s education.

loans.use: to lease an additional plot of farmland to expand her cash-crop growing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 26 years old and has 2 children.  Adela is married and has one child who is in school.

Adela is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Adela requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adela has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Adela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 42 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. 

Leonora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and also runs a sari-sari store. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs. Leonora has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig raising business. 

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Adolfo tiene 40 años, está acompañado con la señora  Estelvina de 32 años, tienen hijos en edad escolar y a su cargo, viven en el centro de la ciudad de Itá donde don Adolfo tiene un taller de costura en el cual realizan terminación de diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir tales como calzas, buzos y shorts.
Adolfo comenta que gracias a la fundación y a otros créditos que ha recibido ha ido creciendo y mejorando. El es una persona muy trabajadora y desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita este crédito para la compra de hilo y ampliación de su taller de costura. Con el tiempo su anhelo es trabajar como confeccionista a gran escala para de esa manera pueda aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Adolfo is 40 years old. He lives with Ms. Estelvina who is 32 years old, and they have school-age children who are dependent on them. They live in the center of the city of Itá.  Mr. Adolfo has a sewing shop there where he makes various kinds of clothing, such as trousers, overalls, and shorts.

Adolfo says that thanks to the foundation and other loans he has received, his business has continued to grow and improve. He is a very hard-working person and wants to continue investing in his business.  That is why he is applying for this loan to buy thread and expand his sewing shop. With time, Adolfo's goal is to work as a large-scale clothing manufacturer so he can increase his income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread and expand his sewing shop.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Floreta works hard to support her family.
She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Floreta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.
Floreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda works hard to support her family. Belinda is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Belinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, soft drinks, eggs, milk, energy drinks, groceries, etc. 

Belinda has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, soft drinks, eggs, milk, energy drinks, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group
