texts.en: Chanthy, 31, is married and has three children, all of whom are still living at home and enrolled in school. To support his entire household, he grows rice on one hectare of farmland and works on another field for a fee. He has been in this line of work for 11 years and earns up to 14,000 KHR per day. He has applied for and repaid previous loans with Chanthy and VisionFund. He feels confident that he can stabilize his family’s living conditions, including provide three decent means a day for his household. He leads a three-person loan group, and will use his portion of this loan to pay to have his land plowed. He hopes that this loan will help him plant his crops on time and earn a good income.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Twige Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe  Twige et elle habite à Cibitoke. Il  a  47 ans et est mariée à Mélanie, un commercant de manioc sec. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, âgés de 8 à 23 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (habits, chaussures, huile de beauté,…) depuis  8ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d'articles de sa boutique  (habits, chaussures, huile de beauté,…), à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter une vache, une chèvre,et un vélo; il voudrait en outre  voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Twige group. He lives in Cibitoke. He is 47 years old and married in Melanie, a dry manioc [cassava] vendor. They have six children ranging from eight to 23 years of age, all of whom study.

[He] has been running a store (clothing, shoes, cosmetic oils etc) for eight years.
[He] is on his 11th loan with Turame. He will use his Kiva credit to bolster his capital and stock up on merchandise for his store (clothing, shoes, cosmetic oils etc) in order to earn more. In the future, he would like to buy a cow, a goat and a bicycle; also, he would like to see his children get an education.

loans.use: to bolster his capital and stock up on merchandise for his store (clothing, shoes, cosmetic oils etc) in order to earn more.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en: A rice farmer from Kandal Province, Sum is married and blessed with five children. Besides working on farming, she also helps her husband to grow vegetables (Cabbage and arum) for extra income.  She is 59 years old and has been involved in her current business for several years; it is the business that provides her about 12,500 KHR per day. Sum is a fifth time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels empowered that she can uplift her family in a gradual manner. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to build a latrine for her household. She hopes to boost the sanitation practice in the family and prevent the relevant disease.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household

loans.name: Reo's Group

texts.en:
The new "Donan Hulu" group was formed about six months ago. The group members meet and visit each other regularly and discuss their businesses together.  Different business from the "Donan Hulu" group include opening a counter selling cell phones and phone calling credit; selling clothes, tissue box covers and traditional Muslim head coverings; selling snacks, selling household items and tools. The group members want to increase the variety and amount of goods they sell with the loan from Kiva.

Reo is the leader of this group. She has a business selling household items and tools. Her husband works as a contractor. Reo has four children, two of whom are in school. With this loan, she wants to purchase other household appliances because her shop has limited types of items right now.  She dreams that in the future she can open a fully stocked appliance store in Cilacap town center. She hopes that this loan from Kiva will help develop the businesses of all of the members.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 45-year-old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He has two children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest is eight months old. He operates a bake shop business. He has been in this business for three years now. This is the source of his income. His wife is a teacher.

Alexander is requesting a loan to buy baking powder, soda, margarine, food coloring, sugar, and yeast. These are the ingredients to be used in baking bread. By the use of this loan, he will be able to buy this ingredients and start baking.
In the future, Alexander hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy baking powder, soda, margarine, food coloring, sugar, and yeast

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a 62-year-old married woman and a mother of six grownup children from Ubay, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business together with her husband for more than 30 years now.

Elpedia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Elpedia believes that this loan could help her improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Peregrino Jr.

texts.en:
Peregrino Jr. is a 53-year-old married man from CPG, Bohol. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Peregrino Jr. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business and eventually his income.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters

loans.name: Bunnhan

texts.en: Bunnhan lives in a rural village in the Dambae district with her husband and two children, both of whom are in school. She is 31 years old and earns a living by growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this line of work for seven years and earn about 18,000 KHR per day. Bunnhan has taken out and repaid one loan from VisionFund and is requesting a new one, for 2,000,000 KHR, to buy pesticides and pay workers to plow her field. She hopes to have a good harvest so that she can improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and have her field plowed.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is a fish vendor from CPG, Bohol. She has been in the fish vending business for more than seven years now. She is also engaged in buying and selling of farm products like banana and others. Leonida is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. Leonida believes that this loan could help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Lourdes Amelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes vive en Salinas. Ella tiene 36 años. Tiene su hogar con todos los suministros públicos. 
Ella empezó a vender productos naturales y como le fue bien decidió seguirlos vendiendo.

Ella realiza su trabajo todos los días en el centro de la ciudad. Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales. Ella nos cuenta que en su negocio ha tenido problemas por parte de los ladrones. la clienta no está casada. pero si tiene 2 hijos, menores de edad, y ambos estudian en una escuela pública, y allá los cría a ambos.

Con el préstamo ella desearía comprar productos naturales como onmilive, dual, star bim. Sus sueños para un futuro sería el de poder tener su propia tienda naturista.  Para  ponerlos en venta en su tienda.
Su sueño es poder tener con la ayuda de DIOS un Minimarket en el centro de la ciudad. Con las ganancias que obtendrá de su tienda.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in Salinas.  She’s 36-years-old.  Her house has all public utilities.  She started out selling natural products and since she did well she decided to continue doing so.  She works downtown every day selling natural products.  She relates that she’s had problems with her business due to thieves.  She’s unmarried but does have two minor children both of which attend public school; she raises both of them.

She would like to use the loan to buy natural products like Omnilife, Dual and others.  Her dream for the future would be to have her own natural products store to sell in her own store.  Her dream is to use profits earned to open a minimarket downtown with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Luisa Alexandra

texts.es:
La Sra. Luisa vive en La Libertad. Ella tiene 32 años de edad. Ella comenzó vendiendo golosinas, y como en el barrio de ella no avían tiendas ella desidia que sería buena idea poner otros productos.

Ella realiza su trabajo en su hogar porque hay tiene la tienda. y por esto se le hace mucho mas fácil emprender esta labor. La labor de la clienta, se enfoca en una tienda que tiene en su hogar

Ella ha tenido problemas en su negocio por los ladrones que viven por su barrio. Ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos que aun son menores de edad, y estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar productos y alimentos como arroz. aceite, azucar, pollo.etc para ponerlos en venta en su tienda. Su sueño es poder tener con la ayuda de DIOS un Minimarket en el centro de la ciudad. Con las ganancias que obtendrá de su tienda.
texts.en:
Luisa, 32, lives in La Libertad.  She started out selling snacks and since there were no stores in her neighborhood decided it would be a good idea to stock other products.  She works at home because she has the store there and this makes it much easier for her to go into this business.  Her work is focused on a home-based store.  She’s had problems with thieves who live in her neighborhood.  She’s a single mother of two children who are still minors attending public school.

She will use the loan to buy products and food items like rice, oil, sugar, chicken, etc. to sell in her store.  Her dream is to be able to open a minimart downtown with God’s help and with the profits earned from her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Hilario vive en Managua, es una persona responsable trabajador, su estado civil es casado con tres persona a su cargo, uno de ellos con edad escolar,  desempeñándose de guarda de seguridad en una institución del estado desde hace tres años.

Solicita a CEPRODEL un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para repellar pared de la casa y darle mejor seguridad.

Agradece a KIVA-CEPRODEL por la oportunidad  y la confianza que le den  con este  financiamiento a otorgándole, para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hilario lives in Managua. He is a responsible, hard-working person.  He is married with three dependents, one who is school-age.  He has worked as a security guard at a state institution for three years.

Mr. Hilario is applying at CEPRODEL for a loan to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement and labor to plaster a wall in his house and give his family greater security.

Mr. Hilario is grateful to KIVA-CEPRODEL for the opportunity and the confidence they give him by granting him this financing to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as sand, cement and labor.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario, a 40-year-old married father of three children from CPG, Bohol, has been engaged in rice farming for more than five years now. He is also in the motorcycle transport business. 

Hilario is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his plants. With this loan, he will be able to improve his farm and also increase his rice harvest. In the future, he hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is 34 years old, single.  He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur.  He owns and operates a fishpond in the local community to earn a living.  He has been in this business for over three years and earns 12,000 PHP every month. In 2011, Jason joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.  He has now requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fish feed and stocks of fish. He hopes and dreams to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish feed and stocks of fish.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 50 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

She owns and operates a snack food vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 6 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month.

She has been with GDMPC since the year 2007 and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such items as coffee, bread and sticky rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as coffee, bread and sticky rice

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en: Avelino is 48 years old, married with four children. He lives Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 4 years and earns 14,000 PHP every month. He has joined GDMPC since the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque is 29 years old and single. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a fishing business to earn money. He has been in his business for more than 3 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: María Arcely

texts.es:
María de 38 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años de edad. Es de origen campesino, debido a que su familia siempre ha vivido en la vereda el Higuerón, del municipio de la Ceja, Colombia. Allí aprendió el oficio de la agricultura. Actividad a la cual se dedica actualmente.
Desde hace trece años decidió emprender un proyecto productivo en conjunto con su padre (en la foto) en un lote de propiedad familiar, sembró un cultivo de café, el cual comercializa a la federación de Caficultores de Antioquia, con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos y mejorar la situación financiera de su familia. 

Su mayor sueño es poder expandir el cultivo y generar fuentes de empleo que permitan producir el mejor café de su región.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos, abonos y químicos, con el fin de mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
María, 38 years old, is a single mother of a son who is 10 years old. She is from the countryside due to the fact that her family has always lived on Higueron lane in the municipality of La Ceja, Colombia. There she learned agriculture, which is what she dedicates herself to now.

Thirteen years ago she decided to learn her trade together with her father (pictured) on a piece of family land. She planted a crop of coffee, which she sells to the Federation of Coffeegrowers of Antioquia in order to generate her own income and improve her family's financial situation.

Her greatest dream is to be able to expand her crop and create employment opportunities that will allow people to produce the best coffee in their region.

She is now requesting a loan that she will use to purchase supplies, fertilizers, and chemicals in order to improve her production.

loans.use: purchase supplies, fertilizer, and chemicals for cultivating coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (necklaces, earrings, and rings)

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun is a 51-year-old married mother of six children living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Cassava planting is the main source of the family’s income, and her husband supplements their income through his job in the local area. Yun has been in this business for 30 years and is able to earn approximately 24,000KHR per day.

Heading a two-person group, Yun is requesting her third loan from VisionFund, while the other member is requesting her second. Yun's past loans, since repaid, enabled her to better support her family as well as her current business; she will use her portion of this new one to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, Yun hopes to grow her cassava healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Hoeut's Group

texts.en:
Hoeut and her family live in Battambang province. She is 41 years old and has seven children, all of whom are still in school. Hoeut is a farmer; her husband also goes fishing when there's spare time from the farming business. 

Hoeut and her female group member applied for a loan of KHR 600,000 each. Hoeut used her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice crop and used the remaining amount for land plowing. 

She hopes the second loan from VisionFund will help her to produce good quality crops to be sold for a higher price, and her children can remain in school.

loans.use: To spend on soil plowing and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ponhea Krek district, Khorn is 29 years old and married. She has two children; one is in school while the other one is too young for school. She is a rice farmer of one hectares of farmland, and supplements the income by raising pigs; her husband is a paid worker. Having been in this business for four years, she currently can earn about 22,000 KHR per day. 

This is the microloan for Khorn’s group of four, and she is the third cycled client. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pig feed for her pig business. 

She hopes this loan will increase her family’s income in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jesus Angel

texts.es:
Jesús es un campesino de 29 años de edad radicado en el municipio de Sonsón, Colombia. Desde su niñez aprendió de las labores del campo debido a que su familia siempre ha residido allí. Laboró con su padre y gracias a este aprendió del oficio. Por tradición continuó con la actividad y hoy es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos de ocho y cinco  años de edad.
En la actualidad tiene sembrados de tomate de árbol, fríjol y uchuva. Con el propósito de sacar una buena cosecha Jesús se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará Compra de insumos agrícolas (fertilizantes, abonos y semillas)y de este modo incrementar y mejorar la calidad de su producción.

Su mayor sueño es poder adecuar su vivienda para garantizarle a su esposa y sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 29-year-old farmer based in the municipality of Sonsón, Colombia.  From his childhood he learned of farm work due to the fact that his family has always resided there.  He worked with his father and thanks to this he learned the trade.  By tradition he continued with this activity and today it is his source of income to support his family which is composed of his wife and their two children who are 8 and 5 years old. 

Currently he has tamarillo, beans and Peruvian ground cherry planted.  With the purpose of getting a good harvest, Jesús is requesting a loan with which he will buy farming supplies (fertilizers and seeds) and in this way generate a more abundant and better quality production.

His greatest dream is to be able to adapt his home to guarantee better living conditions for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Las Manzanas Group

texts.es:
El grupo de *Las Manzanas* esta conformado por mujeres muy trabajadoras que simpre estan al pediente del bienestar de su familia la localidad donde ellos se encuentran ubicados es muy tranquila todos se conocen muy nien desde hace muchos años.
El grupo de las manzanas se llama a si porque la localidad se caracteriza por los huertos de mazanas que existen. Doña Marcelina, quien ha quedado como la representante del grupo platica que tienen 46 años de edad está casada desde hace 22 años con el señor Armando quien trabaja como albañil juntos han procreado 3 niños los cuales se encuentran estudiando diferente niveles educativos, Doña Marcelina se dedica a la cria y engorda de borregos para después venderlos Doña Marce los compra desde que son unos corderitos los crece y engorda por algunos meses y cuando ya están grandes y gordos Doña Marce cuenta que tiene que ofrecerlos a sus vecinos o a los barbacoyeros  o simplemente la gente llega a su casa preguntarle si vende sus borregos porque en la mayoría de los casos quieren comprar porque seguramente tendrán fiesta u alguna otra celebración, lo que les servirá para prepáralos en barbacoa y ofrecerlo como alimento en la fiesta. Esta vez Doña Marce está solicitando un crédito a la institución para comprar más corderitos la cantidad exacta no la sabe porque no sabe en qué precios va a encontrar los corderitos, alimento para los borregos no compra ya que en la comunidad donde vive puede sacarlos a pastar todas las tardes. Con la cría de sus borregos tiene ya dos años, La señora Marce comenta: “ Yo necesitaba de alguna manera ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los gastos de la educación de sus niños y criar los borregos en casa me beneficiaba mucho porque yo criaba mis borregos y al mismo tiempo estaba al pendiente de mis niños”  Solo que su única dificultad es cuando sus borregos enferman y mueren esto para Doña Marce significa una pérdida de ganancia y de la inversión que había ellos.
Doña Marce platica que cuando inicio con la cría de sus borregos no sabía cómo cuidarlos era muy descuidada con sus borregos, cierto día se le ocurrió darle de comer tamales y maíz para los borregos estos alimentos son muy pesados lo que a su borrega le hizo mucho daño y murió, desde ese día Doña Marce nunca más volvió a descuidar de esa manera a su borregos. Pero sus metas es lo que la motivan a seguir criando sus borregos una de sus metas es mejorar su vivienda porque cuenta que le hace falta una buena cocina pero también le gustaría tener un buen local donde pudiera vender algo mas y obtener otra entrada de ganancia. Los integrantes del grupo son Francisco quien invertirá en ropa, Elena quien invertirá en dulces y abarrotes, María quien invertirá en dulces. Todos ellos están muy agradecidos con la institución y KIVA por el crédito otorgado y la confianza que les han tenido en prestarles el crédito para ellos será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Las Manzanas" [The Apples] group is made up of very hardworking women who are always keeping an eye on the well being of their families.  The place where they meet is quite peaceful and they have all known each other very well for many years.  The group got its name because the area is characterized by its apple orchards.

Marcelina, the group's representative, says that she's forty-six and has been married for twenty-two years to Armando, who works as a bricklayer.  They have three children, who are in various grades in school.  Marcelina earns her living raising and fattening up young sheep for later sale.  She buys the sheep as lambs and then raises and fattens them up for a few months.  Once they're big and fat she says she sells them to her neighbors, bbq pitmasters, or just to people who come to her house asking if she sells sheep.  In most of those cases, they probably want to buy a sheep to barbeque for a party or some other kind of celebration.

This time Marce is seeking a loan from the organization to buy more lambs; she's not exactly sure how many because she doesn't know what kind of prices she'll encounter.  She doesn't need to buy food because in her area they can pasture the sheep every afternoon.  She has been raising sheep for two years and says, "I needed a way to help my husband with household expenses and the children's education, and raising sheep at my house has really benefited me because I could raise the sheep while looking after my children."  The only difficulty is when the sheep get sick and die, which means a loss of profits and investment.

Marce says that when she started raising sheep she didn't know how to care for them and was very careless. One day she fed them tamales and corn, which are really fattening and hurt and killed the sheep.  She never neglected her sheep like that again.  Marce's goals motivate her to keep raising her sheep.  One of her objectives is to improve her home because it doesn't have a good kitchen.  She'd also like to have a place where she could sell other things and have another source of income.  

The members of the group include Francisco, who will invest his loan in clothing; Elena, who will buy candy and groceries; and Maria, who will buy candy.  They are all very grateful to the institution and Kiva for the loan.  The trust they've shown in lending the group money will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

location.town: Monte Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann, 47, lives with her husband and six children in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Ann and her husband earn a living as farmers.  They have been farming rice and cassava for almost twenty years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day for family needs. 

This is Ann’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and her group has only three members, all of whom live in the same village.  Ann has been with VisionFund for two cycles, and completely paid back the loans. 

As the leader, Ann is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to pay for labor costs to plant her cassava. 

She hopes to increase her crop yields to generate more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for planting her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lamy's Group

texts.en:
Lamy, 20, is single and lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district. To make a living, she has been cultivating rice and cassava. Her current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day, but she can manage to save approximately 10,000 KHR each day, after daily expenses.

Lamy is new with VisionFund, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for three previous loan cycles. Now, Lamy is leading her group of two, to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her loan portion to pay labor costs, for help in cultivating cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To pay labor costs, for help in her cassava field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce has continued to sell BrightBox to low-income farmers across Western Kenya and establish partnerships that allow farmers to pay for systems over several months. We are reposting the original loan with a higher loan amount due to the overwhelming demand Joyce has built since our first successfully funded loan in December. Thank you!

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers

loans.name: Hilaria Daniela

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilaria vive en La Libertad. Ella tiene 37 años de edad. Ella empezó a vender cosméticos, papeleria, productos de bazar, y como le fue bien decidió a ampliar su negocio de productos.

Ella realiza su trabajo desde las 08:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los dias en un local que tiene en Libertad. Su trabajo es de ventas de papeleria, utiles para niños de escuela. La clienta está casada el esposo es taxista. Ella tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad y estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo ella desea comprar productos como: computadora, mesa, papeleria, utiles escolares. Su sueño para un futuro seria de tener un local de centro de computacion en el centro de libertad.
texts.en:
Hilaria, age 37, lives in La Libertad.  She started selling cosmetics, stationery goods, and household items.  As it went well for her, she decided to expand the products in her business.

She works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day at a place she has in Libertad.  Her work is selling stationery goods and school supplies for children.

She is married, and her husband is a taxi driver.  She has three children, who are all minors and attend public school.

She wishes to use the loan to buy products like a computer, a table, stationery goods, and school supplies.

Her dream for the future would be to have a computer center in the center of Libertad.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a table, stationery goods, and school supplies.

loans.name: Jesús Alexander

texts.es:
El joven Jesús Alexander vive en Managua desde hace 21 años, es una persona casada, tiene bajo su cargo a dos persona, un trabajo estable desde hace  dos años donde se desempeña como higienista en una institución del estado.

 Se presento a CEPRODEL el joven Jesús Alexander para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como cinc, perlines, para reparar el techo de  su vivienda que está en mal estado y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. 

"Espero de KIVA-CEPRODEL el apoyo que le puedan brindar a las personas que necesitan de estos financiamientos, para seguir invirtiendo en las necesidades y le agradezco por esta oportunidad que brindan".
texts.en:
Young Jesús Alexander has lived in Managua for the last 21 years.  He’s married and has two people in his care.  He’s had a steady job for two years working as a hygienist in a state institution.  

He came by Ceprodel  to request a loan in order to buy building supplies like metal sheeting and roof purlins to repair his roof at home that’s in poor condition so that he can provide better living conditions for his family.

“I’m hoping for whatever support Kiva-Ceprodel can give to people who need these loans to continue meeting their needs and I’m grateful for this opportunity you are providing,” he says.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Edina

texts.es:
La Señora Edina es soltera, pero está en pareja, ella es dueña de una granja donde se dedica a la venta de leche y queso además de la venta de cerdos, gallinas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ya que su trabajo no es fácil. 
Ella tiene muy buena experiencia con lo que hace, ya que hace tiempo lo viene haciendo, Su esposo es cosechador de granos y fumigador hace mas de 4 años y por medio del trabajo de ambos mantienen la casa y los gastos del día a día. 
Edina solicita de este crédito para poder adquirir dos vacas lecheras mas que les ayudara a aumentar la producción de queso y leche, y de esa forma seguir con el trabajo que vienen haciendo.
texts.en:
Edina is single and owns a farm where she makes a living from selling milk and cheese and also selling pigs and hens. She is a very hard-working and giving person, as her work is not easy. She has a lot of experience with what she does, as she has been doing it for quite a while. Her husband has been a harvester of grains and an exterminator for more than 4 years and they maintain their home and daily expenses through their work.

Edina asks for this loan in order to be able to acquire two more milk cows that will help her to increase the production of cheese and milk, and thus continue with the work they have been doing.

loans.use: to buy milk cows for the farm.

loans.name: Chandy's Group

texts.en:
Chandy, 46, is married and has three dependent children, one of whom is still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof, located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. The main source of her family’s income is farming; they produce rice and cassava. She has been running her business for almost twenty years. She earns about 40,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

Chandy received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, two loan cycles ago. She used it effectively, to sustain her family’s business, meet her family’s daily needs, and save some money for the future. Now Chandy is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR, each person. As the leader, she is going to use her loan portion to pay labor costs, for help in planting cassava. She hopes to increase her crop yield, to earn more income and make a better living, and also to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To pay labor costs, for help in planting cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en:
Sothea is 47 years old and married. She has four children. Living in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Sothea grows rice and cassava; her husband works as a paid worker. Having been in this business for 25 years, she manages to earn about 18,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

This is Sothea's third loan with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past two loans, which have enabled her family to have enough food. She is leading her group to ask for this new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to rent more plots of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to cover the rental fee of her farmland.

loans.use: To rent more plots of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Heap and her fellow group member are in their third loan cycle with VisionFund. Heap, the group leader, applied for a loan of KHR 700,000, while her fellow member applied for KHR 600,000. Heap will use her loan share to buy fishing tools for her husband's business, to make a chicken cage, and to buy more hens for her to raise. Heap really hopes the loan will enable her family to live in better conditions. 

Heap is 32 years old and has two children, one boy and one girl. Her husband is a fisherman, while she raises hens to sell. They live in the Ek Phnom district, of Battambang province.

loans.use: to make a chicken cage, to buy more hens for her to raise, and to buy fishing tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Walter Edgar

texts.es:
Walter tiene 32 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos

La VRC  Solidaria, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Walter  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida.
 
Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es comprarse un terreno. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta  son las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Walter is 32 years old and in a common-law relationship. He and his wife live in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Solidaria” is located in the neighborhood of San Gabriel in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farmers and ranchers.

Walter is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides. The loan will help him buy what he needs for his farming activities. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas. Walter’s dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges he faces include dealing with crop diseases.

In his free time, Walter enjoys taking a rest.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 26, is married and lives with her family, in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has one son to take care of, and now he is in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and cassava for several years. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day.
 
There are three members in Sreyneang’s group. She is a third-cycle client with VisionFund. She repaid the past loans, which have help her to relieve her family’s financial burdens and improve their livelihood. Now, Sreyneang is leading her group to apply for a new loan. She will use her portion of the loan to pay labor costs, for help in collecting her cassava. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business, so as to make a better living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to pay labor costs, for help in collecting her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab is aged 43 and married. She has seven children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Mab and her husband earn a living by cultivating rice and cassava. Having engaged in this business for 19 years, she is able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day, to support her family.

Mab is a client of VisionFund who has received previous loans, for two loan cycles. The past loans have helped to relieve her family's financial burdens to a great extent. Now, she is leading a group of six members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Mab is going to use her portion of the loan to cover the rental fee of her farmland. She hopes to increase her family's income from her farming business, so as to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To cover the rental fee of her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kimheap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Kimheap is a 33-year-old mother of two children. Both of her children are dependent on her and too young for school. She has been engaged in rice farming to earn a living for five years. Her husband supplements that income by planting cassava and working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 17,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 7,000 KHR each day.

Kimheap's group consists of three members. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and she completely paid back the previous loan. The loan helped her to better support her family. Now she and her group members are applying for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her cassava.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng, 60, is a widow and lives with seven children, in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province. She has struggled to feed her children by farming rice, for twelve years. The current business earns her about 14,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day, after covering daily living expenses.

Yeng’s group is comprised of two members, who are both female. Yeng is a third-cycle client, while the other group member is a second-cycle client with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Yeng has successfully repaid her past loans, which have helped her family relieve their financial burdens and improve their livelihood. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, Yeng, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to lease plots of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her rice paddy business, generating more profit to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To lease plots of farmland, expanding her rice paddy business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Manuela Ramos Group

texts.es:
Les presento al grupo “MANUELA RAMOS” grupo conformado por siete integrantes dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio. Asunta tiene 56 años es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de jugos naturales elaboradas con noni. Su mayor deseo es tener una cadena de juguerias con productos naturales  curativos. El préstamo que  se le hizo lo usara en la compra de frutas. Están   agradecidos con los  inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Asunta es la cuarta  del lado derecho viste con polo blanco con franjas naranja. Judith es la primera del lado izquierdo tiene un pantalón negro se está retirando del grupo  al siguiente ciclo se reincorporara nuevamente.


I present to the group "MANUELA RAMOS" group consists of seven members engaged in various trade activities. Asunta is 56 years old single. It sells natural juices made ​​from noni. His greatest wish is to have a chain of natural products juguerias healing. The loan was made to use him in the purchase of fruits. Investors are grateful for the loan provided KIVA. Assumption is the fourth on the right wears white polo with orange stripes. Judith is the first on the left side has a black pant is pulling out of the group to rejoin again next cycle.
texts.en:
We present to you the "Manuela Ramos" group, made up of seven members who have various businesses. 
Asunta is 56 and single. She sells natural juice made with noni fruit [Morinda citrifolia]. Her greatest desire is to have a chain of juice stores with healing natural products.
She will use this loan for the purchase of fruits. The members are grateful to the Kiva investors for this loan. Asunta is the fourth from the right, wearing a white shirt with orange trim. Judith is first on the left, wearing black pants. She is leaving the group and will rejoin in the next cycle.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Yoert's Group

texts.en:
Yoert is 54 years old and widowed, and she has four children. She lives in a wooden house in the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. The main source of her family’s income is agriculture; they raise pigs. She has been in this business for almost twenty years. With the current business, she can earn about 23,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the fourth loan for Yoert with VisionFund, and she successfully repaid her previous loans. She used the first three loans to improve her livelihood. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Yoert is going to use her loan portion to buy pig feed, for nourishing the animals. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the profit she gets from the pig-raising business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, for nourishing her animals

loans.name: Waldir

texts.es:
Waldir, de 25 años de edad, es padre soltero y  vive en compañía de su hija y su hermana menor en la casa de sus padres.La actividad que realiza Waldir, es el despacho de madera, realizando ventas periódicas a la capital en donde cuenta con compradores , en ocasiones realiza trámites de despacho de madera a empresas, lleva en este negocio un promedio de 2 años, paralelo a estas actividades también cuenta con un taller de mecánica de motores pequeños en su casa,  la cual tiene 01 año de funcionamiento.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su pequeña hija quien es su motivación para seguir adelante, además de ver lo rentable que le resulta trabajar con la venta de madera, tiene planes de aumentar el volumen de sus despachos y ampliar su taller de mecánica.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva por ello esta muy agradecido con el apoyo financiero que recibe para concretar sus planes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.1500 soles para la compra de madera para los despachos que tiene pendiente además de la compra de algunas herramientas de trabajo para su taller .
texts.en:
Waldir, age 25, is a single father who lives with his daughter and younger sister in his parents' home. He sells wood, making periodical sales in the capital where he has buyers. He sometimes delivers wood to businesses. He has had this business for about two years. He also has a mechanic's shop for small vehicles in his home. He has had this shop for one year.
He enjoys his business because it allows him to have an income to cover his household costs, as well as the education costs of his small daughter. She is his motivation to keep moving forward. It is profitable to sell wood. He has plans to increase sales volume and expand his mechanic's workshop. This is his third loan with Kiva, and he is very grateful for the financial support that he receives to meet his goals. He is now requesting 15000 soles for the purchase of wood for his pending orders. He will also buy some work tools for his mechanic's shop.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Evelin Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelin, tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella trabajo varios años en la prestación de servicios domésticos y hace dos años decidió por tener su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: granos básicos, carnes, verduras, frutas, condimentos, pastas, harina, productos de limpieza etc. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras  para  comprar algunos productos que le hacen falta como ser: harina y  granos básicos para surtir el negocio.  Su plan es generar ingresos para aportar con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Evelin is 32 years old and married. She has one child and lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula. She worked for several years providing domestic services and two years ago she decided to set up her own business, where she sells staple goods like basic grains, meat, vegetables, fruit, spices, pasta, flour, cleaning products, etc. 

She has decided to request a 5,000 lempira loan to purchase some of the products she needs, such as flour and basic grains to stock her store. Her plan is to generate income so that she can contribute to covering her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, and flour to sell at her business.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín, es divorciado y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de ocho horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe cubrir sus gastos personales de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que es su única fuente de trabajo para sustentarse.
El sueño de Fermín, es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida para tener más comodidad.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Fermín is a divorced man with 3 adult children. He lives in two small rooms with brick walls in his parent’s house in the Achachicala zone in the city of La Paz.
He currently works more than eight hours a day as a driver. He works late into the night in order to be able to cover his personal food expenses and basic services. 
He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance on his vehicle because this is his only source of income.
Fermín’s dream is to increase his income and quality of life so he can live more comfortably.
This is his second loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for general maintenance on the vehicle he uses for his taxi service.

loans.name: Chhan's Group

texts.en:
Chhan, aged 62, is a mother of nine, two of whom are still in school. Chhan and her family live in the district called Thmor Koul, in Battambang province. She and her husband have been farming rice to support the family, for over twenty years. The main obstacle of their business is having not enough capital to buy fertilizers for the crops. 

Chhan is this group's leader.  The main purpose for Chhan to apply for this loan, is to get fertilizers for their rice field. All three of the members of her loan group are on their fifth loan cycle with VisionFund. Chhan wishes the fertilizer she will buy with the loan will enable her to grow good-quality rice, so that she can sell the crop for a good price. Then she will have more capital, to buy more fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Phoeurn is a widow who overcame the family hardship by rice cropping five hectares. The current business, which she has been with for 10 years, generates about 23,600 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle for Phoeurn with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans that she has succeeded in repaying have enabled her to upgrade her living status and sustain her living. Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to purchase potash for her farmland as well as to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully, so she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase potash for her farmland and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Sav's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Sav has been raising chickens for resale to support her family for almost 20 years. In addition, her husband goes fishing to earn additional income. Sav has six children, all of whom are still in school. Sav is now on her eighth loan cycle with VisionFund; the other member of Sav's group is on her second cycle. 

Due to her good performance, Sav has been selected to be a group leader. Sav will use her portion of the loan to buy fishing tools for her husband and to buy more chickens to raise. She will use the remaining amount of money to buy fertilizers for her vegetable farms. Sav hopes to make more income so that she can save up some money for expanding her business and so her children can have a good future.

loans.use: to buy fishing tools and fertilizers and to raise chickens for sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris, de 31 años de edad, esta casada con Odilo  quien es empleado.  Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos, su abuelo y su esposo, quienes estan instalados cómodamente en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Damaris es la confección, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser  y una máquina remalladora , la cual instaló en su propia casa en donde atiende a sus clientes, quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganarse  su aceptación y la recomendación con otras personas del lugar. Se inicio hace 01 año en éste negocio,el cual lo realiza sola.
Le gusta la confección por que le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar pero le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico que le produce estar sentada , sin embargo eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Por tanto tiene  planes de ampliar su negocio y comprar otras maquinas de coser que le permitan confeccionar mejores prendas. Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva ,por está razón  agradece el apoyo financiero que se le brinda para continuar con su negocio. En está oportunidad solicitará S/.1200  soles, para la compra de materiales de confección como telas, hilos, botones  y otros al por mayor .
texts.en:
Damaris, age 31, is married to Odilo, who has a job. They live with their two children and Damaris' grandfather. They are comfortable in their own home. Damarias sews, a job that she learned when she was studying at an occupational school. She later bought a sewing machine and a darning machine. She set them up in her own home where she serves her customers. They return to her because of her good work. She has gained their acceptance and they recommend her to other people in the area. She started her business one year ago, and she works alone.
She enjoys sewing because it allows her to help her husband with the household costs, but it is a bit inconvenient because she gets physically tired from being seated all the time. However, this does not discourage her and she keeps working hard. She plans to expand her business and buy other sewing machines which will allow her to sew better garments. This is her third loan with Kiva, so she would like to say thank you for this support in continuing with her business. She is requesting 1200 soles for the purchase of sewing materials such as thread, fabric, and buttons wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as thread and needles.

loans.name: Mayra Narcisa

texts.es: Doña Mayra, es una clienta soltera con  un hijo de 27 años quien ya trabaja y le ayuda a ella en los gastos del hogar, ella continua con su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, lleva aproximadamente 6 años en este negocio mediante el cual ha sostenido su hogar, este tercer crédito solicitado es para seguir mejorando el techo de su casa que todavía le falta una gran parte, comprara laminas de zinc, vigas de madera y pagara la mano de obra.
texts.en: Doña Mayra is a single client with one child, age 27, who is already working and helps her with the household costs. She is continuing with her clothing and cosmetics business. She has had this business for about six years. Through it, she has supported her household. This is her third loan, requested so that she can keep repairing her home's roof. A large part is still missing. She will purchase zinc laminate and wooden beams, and pay the labourers.

loans.use: to buy zinc laminate and wooden beams, and to pay the labour.

loans.name: Martin Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene 43 años, tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de 12, 10 y 5 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de material de construcción como ripio, y piedra para fachadas de las casas, tiene su depósito que encuentran en la zona de Las Retamas, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Martin va a usar este préstamo para la compra de piedras por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que el quiere comprar por mayor ya que esta época el precio de la piedra incrementa, El Sr. Martin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios y reinvertirlos en el negocio su deseo  para su negocio es tener más clientela y así genera mayores ingresos para el bienestar de el y de sus hijos ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is 43 and has three children who are ages twelve, ten, and five. He works selling construction materials like gravel and stone for the outer walls of houses. He has a warehouse located in the Las Retamas area, and this is his first cycle with our institution.

Martin is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale stone. The reason why he is requesting this loan is a lack of working capital. He wants to buy wholesale because the price of stone rises this time of year. Martin faces challenges in his business, mainly competition for the area, and he is going to use his profits to reinvest in his business. 

He wants his business to have more customers so that it generates higher income for him and his children to live more comfortably, since this is his only source of work, which allows him to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like wholesale stone.

loans.name: Sokhoeuy

texts.en:
A mother of four children living in Ek Phom district, Battambang Province, Sokhoeuy is 31 years old. She earns a living by cultivating watermelons. To supplement the family income, her husband farms rice, and catches fish to sell. She has been involved in the current business for five years.

This is the first loan for Sokhoeuy with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking to borrow 1,500,000 KHR, to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cash crop. She has high hopes that she can double the yield and thereby earn more income, for her family’s sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cash crop

loans.name: Hoeurb's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurb is a mother of six children, two of whom are students. To make a living, Hoeurb and her husband have been farming rice for over ten years. Hoeurb's husband goes fishing to make additional income for the family, especially for the two little children's education. 

Because of her good performance as a borrower of previous loans, Hoeurb was appointed to be a group leader, leading a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Hoeurb requested a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve her rice crop. She will spend the remaining amount on land plowing. Through this loan, Hoeurb hopes to earn more income for her family to live happily, have enough food to eat, and have proper clothes to wear.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Nay is a 31-year-old married mother of four dependent children, two of whom are still in school while the remaining two are too young. Nay and her husband have earned a living farming rice, garlic, and cabbage for ten years. The current business earns Nay about 18,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Nay’s group with VisionFund. Nay, who is the leader of her group, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. Nay hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.
